incident: Train fault disrupted East-West Line service between Pasir Ris and Tanah Merah on 15 Mar 2017
description: A train fault delayed East-West Line between Pasir Ris and Tanah Merah towards Joo Koon. The incident started at around 11:20am on Wednesday morning and the delay lasted for at least 25 minutes. Free bus services were activated.

incident: Signalling fault disrupted Circle Line service between Bishan and HarbourFront on 24 Feb 2017
description: A signalling fault delayed Circle Line between Bishan and HarbourFront on Friday during peak morning commute. The incident started at around 7:30am and the delay lasted for at least 10 minutes.

incident: Train fault disrupted East-West Line service between Joo Koon and Lakeside on 23 Feb 2017
description: A train fault delayed East-West Line between Joo Koon and Lakeside on Thursday during peak morning commute. The incident started at around 8:30am and the delay lasted for at least 10 minutes. SMRT advised that trains would be progressively restored to normal speed after the fault is cleared.

incident: Train fault disrupted North-South Line service between Jurong East and Ang Mo Kio on 13 Feb 2017
description: A train fault at Admiralty station on the North-South Line led to delays and snaking queues at MRT stations on Monday morning (Feb 13). Train operator SMRT first alerted commuters in a tweet at 7.58am, informing them of the delay and to factor in 20 minutes of additional travelling time from Jurong East to Ang Mo Kio, in the direction of Marina South Pier. In another tweet 10 minutes later, SMRT said the delay was caused by a train fault at Admiralty station. Free regular bus services were running between Woodlands and Yishun stations in both directions, it added. At 8.26am, SMRT said train services had resumed, although trains were travelling slower due to the earlier fault. Free bus services ceased about 20 minutes after that. (CNA, 13 Feb 2017)

incident: Track fault disrupted East-West Line service between Joo Koon and Boon Lay on 12 Feb 2017
description: A track fault resulted in no train service on the East-West Line between Joo Koon and Boon Lay. The incident occurred at the beginning of revenue service at around 5:50am on Sunday. The delay lasted for at least 1 hour and bus bridging services were activated. SMRT continued to warn of delays after the fault was cleared, although it is unclear whether this is due to congestion or reduced train speeds for safety.

incident: Power fault disrupted Sengkang LRT East Loop service on 10 Feb 2017
description: A power fault disrupted Sengkang LRT East Loop service on Friday at around 9pm. The delay lasted for at least 20 minutes and bus bridging services were activated.

incident: Train fault disrupted Bukit Panjang LRT service on 10 Feb 2017
description: A power fault disrupted Bukit Panjang LRT service on Friday at around 3:20pm. The delay lasted for at least 15 minutes and bus bridging services were activated.

incident: Signalling fault disrupted North-South Line service between Newton and Marina South Pier on 10 Feb 2017
description: A track fault disrupted North-South Line service from Netwon towards Marina South Pier. The incident occured on Friday at around 8am during peak morning commute. The delay lasted for at least 20 minutes and free regular bus services were activated. "The train that caused delays on the North-South Line during the morning rush hour on Friday (Feb 10) has been withdrawn from service, SMRT said. In response to a query by The Straits Times, rail operator SMRT's Vice President for Corporate Information and Communications, Mr Patrick Nathan, said: “A train on the North-South Line travelling from Raffles Place towards Yishun developed a signalling fault this morning. "It was subsequently withdrawn from service after passengers disembarked at Raffles Place. We are sorry for the inconvenience caused.” (ST, 10 Feb 2017)

incident: Faulty track point disrupted East-West Line service between Jurong East and Joo Koon on 7 Feb 2017
description: The MRT delays that occurred on Tuesday (7 February) morning on the East-West Line (EWL) were the result of “urgent works” near Joo Koon MRT station, said SMRT in a Facebook post. The works were to replace a track point, which guides the direction of train travel. Such works usually take place on weekends to minimise the inconvenience caused to commuters. However, due to the “urgency and criticality” of the situation, the train operator began replacement works on Monday night instead. These works were still being carried out as of 2pm on Tuesday. With only one platform at Joo Koon station being in operation, those travelling from Jurong East to Joo Koong “experienced longer journeys this morning (Tuesday)”, the post said. SMRT also added that “their engineers will complete the replacement works and get the track point up and running after the end of service”. Arrangements were also made to minimise the congestion from Jurong East to Joo Koon during Tuesday’s evening peak service period, with SMRT saying it would deploy additional staff to assist commuters at stations. (Yahoo, 8 Feb 2017)

incident: Signalling fault disrupted Downtown Line service on 31 Jan 2017
description: A signalling fault disrupted Downtown Line service on Tuesday at around 6:40pm during peak evening commute. The delay lasted for at least 1.5 hours.

incident: Track fault disrupted East-West Line service between Joo Koon and Clementi on 23 Jan 2017
description: Train service on a stretch of the East-West Line returned to normal last night after encountering disruptions at peak hour for almost four hours. The train disruption began at about 6.30pm and service returned to normal at about 10.15pm. The Straits Times understands that a track circuit between Jurong East and Clementi MRT stations had failed. To alleviate the eastbound build-up of commuters, some westbound services got passengers to disembark at Queenstown MRT Station. The trains then turned around to ferry eastbound passengers from Redhill MRT Station. Train operator SMRT advised commuters at around 7.30pm to expect additional travel time of 25 minutes from Joo Koon towards Clementi, due to a track fault at Jurong East MRT Station. (ST, 24 Jan 2017)

incident: Track fault disrupted East-West Line service between Joo Koon and Clementi on 19 Jan 2017
description: A track fault that occurred on the East-West Line on Thursday (Jan 19) morning caused delays from Joo Koon to Clementi stations towards Pasir Ris. Services resumed nearly two hours later at 9.28am. SMRT first tweeted about the delay at 7.46am, warning of an additional 10 minutes travel time required from Joo Koon to Clementi stations towards Pasir Ris. At 8.01am, SMRT sent an update that the track fault was at Clementi and the delay had been extended to 15 minutes. About 25 minutes later, it said to expect a delay of 20 minutes. (ST. 19 Jan 2017)

incident: Track fault disrupted North-South Line service between City Hall and Ang Mo Kio on 13 Jan 2017
description: A track fault disrupted North-South Line service between City Hall and Ang Mo Kio. The incident occurred on Friday at around 8:20pm. Although the track fault was cleared in 10 minutes, delays continued because SMRT reduced the train speed from Bishan to Ang Mo Kio, citing safety as a reason.

incident: Power fault disrupted Punggol West LRT service on 9 Jan 2017
description: A power fault disrupted Punggol West LRT service at around 10pm on Monday evening. This resulted in a delay of at least 20 minutes. Free bus rides were made available at designated stops near the stations.

incident: Track fault disrupted East-West Line service between Boon Lay and Clementi on 4 Jan 2017
description: A track fault disrupted East-West Line service between Boon Lay and Clementi towards Pasir Ris. The incident occurred near Clementi station on Wednesday at around 7:40am during peak hour commute. This resulted in a delay of at least 50 minutes.

incident: Track fault disrupted East-West Line service between Aljunied and Outram Park on 23 Dec 2016
description: The East-West Line suffered three faults in less than 24 hours, with the most recent one on Friday morning (Dec 23). The first one happened on Thursday night. At about 7.30pm, SMRT posted on Twitter an alert on the track fault, telling commuters to expect an additional 15 minutes of travel time from Outram Park station to Eunos station towards Pasir Ris station. By 8.24pm, the fault had been cleared, according to a post on SMRT’s Twitter page. The second fault happened at about 5.33am on Friday, and halted services between Outram Park station and Aljunied station. A traction power fault was reported near Bugis station during maintenance hours, said SMRT. “Our engineers managed to rectify the fault before the start of service, and train services began on time,” said Ms Margaret Teo, head of Corporate Marketing and Communications at SMRT Corporation. According to a post on its Twitter page, services resumed by 5.43am. SMRT alerted commuters to the third fault at 7.14am on Twitter. A track fault had occurred at Eunos station, causing the trains to travel at slower speeds from Kembangan station to Eunos station. SMRT said this was for passenger safety. “Our engineers have rectified the fault, and normal train service resumed at 0955hrs,” said Ms Teo. All three faults were unrelated, said SMRT. (CNA, 23 Dec 2016)

incident: Power fault disrupted East-West Line service between Aljunied and Outram Park on 23 Dec 2016
description: The East-West Line suffered three faults in less than 24 hours, with the most recent one on Friday morning (Dec 23). The first one happened on Thursday night. At about 7.30pm, SMRT posted on Twitter an alert on the track fault, telling commuters to expect an additional 15 minutes of travel time from Outram Park station to Eunos station towards Pasir Ris station. By 8.24pm, the fault had been cleared, according to a post on SMRT’s Twitter page. The second fault happened at about 5.33am on Friday, and halted services between Outram Park station and Aljunied station. (CNA, 23 Dec 2016)

incident: Track fault disrupted East-West Line service between Eunos and Outram Park on 22 Dec 2016
description: The East-West Line suffered three faults in less than 24 hours, with the most recent one on Friday morning (Dec 23). The first one happened on Thursday night. At about 7.30pm, SMRT posted on Twitter an alert on the track fault, telling commuters to expect an additional 15 minutes of travel time from Outram Park station to Eunos station towards Pasir Ris station. SMRT said this was for passenger safety. “Our engineers have rectified the fault, and normal train service resumed at 0955hrs,” said Ms Teo. All three faults were unrelated, said SMRT. (CNA, 23 Dec 2016)

incident: Signalling fault disrupted East-West Line service between Pasir Ris and Outram Park on 14 Dec 2016
description: A signalling fault disrupted East-West Line service between Pasir Ris and Outram Park. The incident occurred near Aljunied station on Wednesday at around 8:20am during peak hour commute. This resulted in a delay of at least 30 minutes.

incident: Track fault disrupted East-West Line service between City Hall and Jurong East on 6 Dec 2016
description: A track fault disrupted East-West Line service between City Hall and Jurong East towards Joo Koon. The incident occurred on Tuesday at around 8pm. This resulted in a delay of at least 15 minutes. It is unknown as to whether this incident is related to a signalling fault that occurred just one hour earlier.

incident: Signalling fault disrupted East-West Line service between Boon Lay and Joo Koon on 6 Dec 2016
description: A signalling fault disrupted East-West Line service between Boon Lay and Joo Koon. The incident occurred on Tuesday at around 7pm during peak hour commute. This resulted in a delay of at least 30 minutes. Bus bridging services were activated.

incident: Track fault disrupted East-West Line service between Bugis and Tanah Merah on 18 Nov 2016
description: A track fault disrupted East-West Line service between Bugis and Tanah Merah towards Joo Koon. The track fault occurred near Lavender station on Friday at around 6pm during peak hour commute. This resulted in a delay of at least 20 minutes.

incident: Train fault disrupted North-East Line service on 14 Nov 2016
description: A train fault that occurred at Outram Park station caused delays on the North East Line (NEL) for more than an hour on Monday (Nov 14) morning. Full service resumed at around 10.30am with free bus rides and bridging buses services still available at designated bus stops. SBS Transit tweeted the delay at 9.33am, warning of an additional 15 minutes of travel time along the NEL. At 9.56am, SBS Transit tweeted that free bus rides were available at designated bus stops between HarbourFront and Dhoby Ghaut stations. SBS Transit announced that full service had resumed at 10.36am. (ST, 14 Nov 2016)

incident: Telco signals suspended to investigate signal interference on Circle Line service on 5 Nov 2016
description: Due to railway signalling issues, the Land Transport Authority (LTA) instructed telcos to shut off mobile network access along the line throughout Friday and Saturday morning as SMRT engineers sought to determine the cause of intermittent signal interference. SMRT told commuters there could be delays in train services and that the normally driverless trains would be manned as a precaution.

incident: Telco signals suspended to investigate signal interference on Circle Line service on 4 Nov 2016
description: Due to railway signalling issues, the Land Transport Authority (LTA) instructed telcos to shut off mobile network access along the line throughout Friday and Saturday morning as SMRT engineers sought to determine the cause of intermittent signal interference. SMRT told commuters there could be delays in train services and that the normally driverless trains would be manned as a precaution.

incident: Telco signals suspended to investigate signal interference on Circle Line service on 3 Nov 2016
description: A day after yet another rush-hour disruption on the Circle Line due to railway signalling issues, the Land Transport Authority (LTA) instructed telcos to shut off mobile network access along the line for about two hours on Thursday evening (Nov 3) as SMRT engineers sought to determine the cause of intermittent signal interference. SMRT told commuters there could be delays in train services and that the normally driverless trains would be manned as a precaution. (CNA, 3 Nov 2016)

incident: Track fault disrupted East-West Line service between Queenstown and Outram Park on 2 Nov 2016
description: A train fault disrupted East-West Line service between Queenstown and Outram Park towards Pasir Ris. The train fault occurred at Tiong Bahru station on Wendesday at around 5:40pm during peak hour commute. Bus bridging services were activated. For safety reasons, trains were travelling at slower speeds after the fault was cleared.

incident: Signalling fault disrupted Circle Line service on 2 Nov 2016
description: According to operator SMRT, the Circle Line “encountered intermittent signal interference” that caused one train to stall between the Marymount and Botanic Gardens station. The glitch affected operations throughout the whole line and trains had to travel at a slower speed. The transport operator first posted on its Twitter account at 7:37 am that there would be an additional travelling time of 10 minutes between Pasir Panjang and one North stations due to a signal fault. Two minutes later, SMRT tweeted that the fault was resolved, only to announce at 8:04 am that trains are moving slower, again due to a signal fault. At 8:16 am, they said that an additional 20 minutes of travelling time should be factored in for those travelling on the Circle Line. At 9:06 am, SMRT gave an update, saying there was no train service between Botanic Gardens and Marymount stations. This later extended to Serangoon station, it said at 9:32 am. Full train service resumed at 10:27 am, while free bus services ceased at 11:30 am. (Yahoo, 2 Nov 2016)

incident: Track fault disrupted East-West Line service between Pasir Ris and Bugis on 27 Oct 2016
description: Westbound train services on the East-West Line approaching Bugis station were delayed this morning due to a track circuit fault near the station at 8.10am. For passenger safety, trains travelled at a slower speed over the affected stretch. Train services continued to run as some westbound trains were turned around to ease congestion during the morning peak. As track access is required for inspection, our engineers were only able to assess the fault after the morning peak at 10.55 am. Full train service resumed at 11.30am. (SMRT statement)

incident: Train fault disrupted Bukit Panjang LRT Line service on 26 Oct 2016
description: At 5:10pm today, a two-car LRT train encountered a stuck brake after Bukit Panjang station towards Phoenix station. Staff were immediately deployed to the train to assist passengers to safely detrain to Bukit Panjang station. Free regular bus and bus bridging services were activated as an alternative for commuters, and services on the BPLRT network was temporarily suspended to allow our engineers track access to assess the fault. They were eventually able to release the brakes, and the faulty train was pulled back to the depot for further investigations. Full services resumed at 7:10pm. We are sorry for the inconvenience caused. (SMRT statement)

incident: Train fault disrupted East-West Line service on 25 Oct 2016
description: A train fault disrupted East-West Line service. The incident occurred on Tuesday at around 7am during peak hour commute. It is unknown how long train service was delayed as SMRT did not make any public announcements on Twitter and Facebook.

incident: Train fault disrupted East-West Line service between Queenstown and Jurong East on 21 Oct 2016
description: Train journeys on the MRT's East-West Line were delayed during the morning peak hour yesterday, in what was the second major incident to hit Singapore's second-oldest line in three days. Yesterday's glitch was caused by a westbound train which stalled near Dover station. Operator SMRT tweeted about the delay at 7.01am, warning that travel time from Queenstown to Jurong East - five stations away - would take 20 minutes more than usual. SMRT spokesman Patrick Nathan said the driver of a westbound train reported at around 6.45am that its brakes were stuck. Mr Nathan said this happened "just before the train entered Dover MRT station". "A rescue train was subsequently coupled to the defective train to push it to Dover station for passengers to disembark," he added. (ST, 22 Oct 2016)

incident: Track fault disrupted East-West Line service between Tanah Merah and Bugis on 18 Oct 2016
description: A track fault disrupted East-West Line service between Tanah Merah and Bugis towards Joo Koon. The incident occurred on Tuesday at around 7pm during peak hour commute. Train service was delayed for at least 1 hour 45 minutes.

incident: Track fault disrupted East-West Line service between Pasir Ris and Outram Park on 6 Oct 2016
description: A track fault near Paya Lebar disrupted East-West Line service between Outram Park and Pasir Ris towards Pasir Ris. The incident occurred on Thursday at around 9:30am. Train service was delayed for at least 50 minutes.

incident: Dislodged platform door disrupted Downtown Line service on 4 Oct 2016
description: A dislodged platform door caused a two-hour disruption on part of the Downtown Line during the morning peak period on Tuesday (Oct 4). The disruption, which affected trains running between King Albert Park and Sixth Avenue stations, happened at about 6.25am after a “platform screen door fault” at Sixth Avenue station, operator SBS Transit said in a statement. Train service resumed at 8.25am after the dislodged platform door was removed. The affected area – Doors 9 and 10 on Platform B at the Sixth Avenue station – has been cordoned off, SBS Transit said. "Work on repairing the platform screen door will be carried out after passenger service hours tonight. We are investigating the cause of the platform screen door fault with the LTA (Land Transport Authority) and the contractor," the transport operator said. (CNA, 4 Oct 2016)

incident: Track fault disrupted Bukit Panjang LRT service on 27 Sep 2016
description: Train service on the Bukit Panjang Light Rail Transit (BPLRT) was temporarily suspended on Wednesday afternoon (Sep 28) to facilitate "urgent inspections" after a track fault, operator SMRT said. The track fault, which happened on Tuesday evening, caused 15 train cars to be damaged and delayed service from about 10pm. Engineers worked through the night to rectify the fault and to replace damaged devices on the train cars, SMRT said in a Facebook post. The damaged trains are at the BPLRT depot at Ten Mile Junction and investigations into the incident are ongoing, it said. Train service on the line only resumed at 6.40am on Wednesday, more than an hour later than scheduled, with just six trains – half the usual number. But at 10.20am, the network encountered a power trip due to another track fault, and 50 passengers had to disembark a train about 20m from Choa Chu Kang station. “A signal rail joint on the BPLRT network was damaged yesterday evening, and the cause is still being investigated. This caused damage to the current collector devices (CCDs) on the BPLRT train cars as they moved over the damaged rail joint," SMRT said. "Preliminary findings show that the damaged current collector devices on the train cars may have further affected other parts of the track network, before they were replaced after service hours last night." (CNA, 28 Sep 2016)

incident: Track fault disrupted Circle Line service on 20 Sep 2016
description: Train service along the Circle Line was delayed during the morning rush hour on Tuesday (Sep 20) due to a track fault, operator SMRT said. “A fault was reported this morning at a track point on the Circle Line near Paya Lebar Station, in the direction of MacPherson," said Mr Patrick Nathan, SMRT's Vice-President for Corporate Information and Communications. He said that engineers could only rectify the fault after the morning peak hours as it required track access. For passengers' safety, trains travelled slower over the affected stretch, he added. "To ease congestion, some trains were turned around at Bartley station in the direction of HarbourFront, and free bus services were activated between Bishan and Paya Lebar stations. We apologise for the inconvenience,” Mr Nathan said. (CNA, 21 Sep 2016)

incident: Track fault disrupted Circle Line service between Paya Lebar and MacPherson on 5 Sep 2016
description: A track fault disrupted Circle Line service between Paya Lebar and MacPherson towards Harbourfront. The incident occurred on Monday at around 8:20pm. Train service was delayed for at least 50 minutes.

incident: Signalling fault disrupted Circle Line service on 2 Sep 2016
description: Yet, that has been happening the whole of this week. Because of an unknown signal interference in the tunnels, communication between trains and track is lost intermittently. This has the effect of a train going blind and deaf momentarily, and causes yet another fail-safe system to kick in - the emergency brakes. Because the train does not "know" where it is going, it stops. Each time a train stops, its signalling system has to be reset to get it to move again. These events, repeated many times a day, causes journeys to be longer and more uncomfortable. Operator SMRT has also decided to man the driverless trains. They take over when the train goes "blind" and "deaf". The staff onboard, however, do not drive the trains on manual mode completely - not for extended periods of time anyway. So, commuters will continue to face longer and jerkier journeys until the problem is fixed. Experts from systems supplier Alstom have flown in to assist. (ST, 2 Sep 2016)

incident: Signalling fault disrupted Circle Line service on 1 Sep 2016
description: Commuters were told to expect delays as signalling problems continued to plague the Circle Line for the fourth day in a row, according to a news release issued by the Land Transport Authority (LTA) and SMRT early on Thursday (Sep 1). Commuters should factor in extra travel time to get to their appointments on time, the release said. "We have narrowed the problem to signal interference, causing intermittent loss of signal between trains and stations," LTA and SMRT said, adding that they are working with a team of experts from train manufacturer Alstom to resolve the issue. (CNA, 1 Sep 2016)

incident: Signalling fault disrupted Circle Line service on 31 Aug 2016
description: The Circle Line is in its third day of disrupted service on Wednesday (Aug 31) after a signalling problem was first reported on Monday. Rail operator SMRT has been tweeting since Tuesday evening that commuters should expect a longer journey. It has also warned that intermittent braking may occur and commuters should hold onto handrails for their safety. SMRT has said that a signalling fault involving wireless communication between the train and the track is to blame. "Initial investigations point to possible signal interference in tunnels causing loss of signal between the trains and stations which our engineers are trying to confirm," said vice-president for corporate information and communications Patrick Nathan in response to media queries. Mr Nathan said SMRT has been investigating the fault since Monday. (ST, 31 Aug 2016)

incident: Track fault disrupted North-South Line service on 30 Aug 2016
description: A track fault caused delays of up to 20 minutes on the North-South Line during the morning rush-hour on Tuesday (Aug 30), resulting in overcrowded trains and stations, and longer commutes. Trains ran at significantly slower speeds for about three hours, and regular services resumed at 9.10am. The trip-up on the North-South Line was traced to track-side signalling equipment “near Choa Chu Kang”, transport operator SMRT said, adding that it was investigating the problem. SMRT first tweeted at 6.08am that the fault had crippled train services from the Yew Tee to Bukit Gombak stations, and announced that free regular bus services were available. Although train services resumed about 15 minutes later, Mr Patrick Nathan, SMRT’s vice-president of corporate information and communications, said that trains had to be driven manually at 18kmh through the affected stretch for the safety of passengers. Given that this was down from the usual train speed of 60 to 80kmh, it resulted in slower journeys for commuters and led to congestion in trains and stations, adding up to 20 minutes of extra travelling time between the Woodlands and Jurong East stops. (TODAY, 30 Aug 2016)

incident: Signalling fault disrupted Circle Line service on 30 Aug 2016
description: The Circle Line delay took place at the same time as a three-hour disruption on the North-South Line, which SMRT later attributed to a fault with track-side signalling equipment near Choa Chu Kang MRT station. Circle Line train speeds and service frequency first took a hit during morning rush hour on Monday, when commuters complained of packed stations and poor communication about the problem. It was not until Monday afternoon that SMRT announced that unspecified "intermittent signalling issues" were to blame. SMRT has been carrying out tests and investigations ever since, said SMRT vice-president for corporate information and communications Patrick Nathan, but the issue has not yet been resolved. He added that SMRT is working with the Land Transport Authority and the contractor to address the problem, which has since been identified as a fault in wireless communication between signalling equipment on the train and on the track. (ST, 30 Aug 2016)

incident: Signalling fault disrupted Circle Line service on 29 Aug 2016
description: "Intermittent signalling issues" affected services along the Circle Line on Monday (Aug 29), according to public transport operator SMRT. This comes after commuters on the Circle Line reported delays in train services, as well as unusual crowds. Its Vice President of Corporate Information and Communications Patrick Nathan said the issues will likely cause delays of about 1 to 2 minutes during non-peak hours and 5 to 10 minutes during peak hours, until the end of service on Monday. "More SMRT staff have been deployed to our Circle Line stations to assist passengers," Mr Nathan said in a statement. "Our staff will also be on board the Circle Line trains for the rest of the day." SMRT also advised commuters standing on board Circle Line trains to hold onto handrails, as they may experience intermittent braking. "Our engineers are working to resolve the issue as quickly as possible," Mr Nathan said. Commuters had reported delays along the Circle Line from about 8am on Monday. (CNA, 29 Aug 2016)

incident: Train fault disrupted North-East Line service between Woodleigh and Punggol on 17 Aug 2016
description: Train service on the North-East Line resumed after a disruption lasting more than an hour due to a train fault on Wednesday night (Aug 17). This affected train services in both directions, according to the Land Transport Authority (LTA). Seven stations - from Woodleigh to Punggol - were affected by the disruption, but services progressively resumed. Commuters said on social media that the disruption began as early as 8.50pm. As of 9.54pm, train service at three stations - Punggol, Sengkang and Buangkok - were still down, according to SBS Transit's Twitter account. At about 10.25pm, SBS Transit informed commuters via Twitter that services were running at all stations. Channel NewsAsia understands that there was a train stuck between Sengkang and Buangkok stations. SBS Transit told commuters that free bus services were available at designated bus stops near affected stations. Crowds were seen waiting for free buses outside Serangoon and Woodleigh stations. (CNA, 17 Aug 2016)

incident: Track fault disrupted North-South Line service between Braddell and Marina South Pier on 16 Aug 2016
description: A track fault disrupted North-South Line service between Braddell and Marina South Pier towards Jurong East. The incident occurred on Tuesday at around 8:40am. Train service was delayed for at least 1 hour.

incident: Air-con coolant gas leak forced passenger detrainment at Tanjong Pagar station on 15 Aug 2016
description: At 2:53pm this afternoon, passengers at Tanjong Pagar MRT station were detrained from a westbound train due to a leak of freon gas from the train’s air-conditioning system. The discharge of freon into the tunnel reduced visibility at parts of the station when the platform screen doors were opened for passengers to exit the train. SMRT staff switched on the tunnel ventilation system immediately to disperse the odourless gas. The train was withdrawn from passenger service to allow the air-conditioning system to be checked. The passenger platform at Tanjong Pagar MRT station remained in service during this incident and train services were not affected. (SMRT, 15 Aug 2016)

incident: Track fault disrupted East-West Line service between Boon Lay and Joo Koon on 11 Aug 2016
description: A track fault disrupted East-West Line service between Joo Koon and Boon Lay towards Koo Koon. The incident occurred on Thursday around 10:25pm. Train service was delayed for at least 20 minutes, as travelling times were delayed even after service recovery. Free regular bus services were made available.

incident: Track fault disrupted North-South Line service between Yishun and Bishan on 6 Aug 2016
description: A track fault disrupted North-South Line service between Yishun and Bishan towards Marina South Pier. The incident occurred on Saturday around 9am. Train service was delayed for at least 3 hours, according to the timing of SMRT's tweets on the incident. There was a long gap in SMRT's tweets between 9am and 12pm.

incident: Track fault disrupted North-South Line service between Ang Mo Kio and Admiralty on 2 Aug 2016
description: In addition to the morning service delays, there was a disruption at lunchtime between Ang Mo Kio and Admiralty stations. An SMRT tweet at 1.25pm advised commuters that they could expect an additional travelling time of 15 minutes between Ang Mo Kio and Admiralty stations heading towards Jurong East. Services were restored 22 minutes later. The Straits Times understands that the delay was due to rectification works for the morning incident at Admiralty. SMRT apologised to commuters affected by the service disruptions and said the loss of power to trackside signalling equipment had caused the interruption between Joo Koon and Boon Lay. "This caused two west-bound trains to be held between Pioneer and Joo Koon stations," said SMRT spokesman Patrick Nathan, adding that power engineers were "quickly deployed" to restore power to the affected stretch. The cause of the power fault was being investigated, he said. Meanwhile, the delay on the North-South Line was caused by a "track point failure" near Admiralty station, which prevented trains from moving from one track to another. Instead, personnel on the track had to manually allow the trains to switch tracks. (ST, 3 Aug 2016)

incident: Track fault disrupted North-South Line service between Yishun and Woodlands on 2 Aug 2016
description: A track fault disrupted North-South Line service between Yishun and Woodlands in both directions. The incident occurred on Tuesday around 9am, during peak hour commute. Train service was delayed for at least 20 minutes.

incident: Track fault disrupted East-West Line service between Joo Koon and Boon Lay on 2 Aug 2016
description: A track fault disrupted East-West Line service between Joo Koon and Boon Lay in both directions. The incident occurred on Tuesday around 8:50am, during peak hour commute. Train service was delayed for at least 40 minutes. Bus bridging services were activated.

incident: Platform door fault disrupted East-West Line service between Bugis and Pasir Ris on 31 Jul 2016
description: Train service on the East-West Line was delayed on Sunday (July 31) afternoon, apparently due to a problem with the platform doors. Operator SMRT said in a tweet at 4.54pm that commuters should expect an additional travelling time of 15 minutes between Bugis and Pasir Ris MRT stations. In another tweet at 5.18pm, it said its engineers were working to fix the problem. The fault was subsequently rectified, SMRT said in a tweet at 5.48pm. The problem appeared to be at Kembangan station, according to a series of tweets by Twitter user @mayzeit. Her first tweet at 4.29pm said that trains were stuck at the station as the platform doors would not open. The doors had to be forced open, she claimed. Another commuter, Zhi Qian, said on Twitter it was a technical problem with the doors at the stations. (ST, 31 Jul 2016)

incident: Train fault disrupted North-East Line service on 29 Jul 2016
description: A train fault at Buangkok station caused a delay on the North East Line on Friday (July 29) morning. SBS Transit which operates the line, said in a tweet at 7.31am that commuters should expect an additional 15 minutes of travelling time. Free bus rides were also deployed between Potong Pasir and Punggol stations. In a response to the delay, SBS Transit said "Train services between Punggol and Potong Pasir Stations on the North East Line were delayed for about 50 minutes this morning due to a train fault at Buangkok Station. Service resumed at about 8.11am". (ST, 29 Jul 2016)

incident: Train fault disrupted North-South Line service between Marina Bay and Marina South Pier on 26 Jul 2016
description: A train fault disrupted North-South Line service between Marina Bay and Marina South Pier in both directions. The incident occurred on Tuesday around 4pm, resulting in delays of at least 15 minutes. Bus bridging services were activated.

incident: Overrun of maintenance works disrupted East-West Line service between Bugis and Changi Airport, Pasir Ris on 26 Jul 2016
description: Sleeper replacement works disrupted East-West Line service between Bugis and Changi Airport, Pasir Ris in both directions. The incident occurred on Tuesday at around 5:30am, during peak hour commute, resulting in delays of at least 30 minutes. It is likely that the upgrading works have overrun its schedule as the late start of revenue service was not announced previously.

incident: Train fault disrupted North-South Line service between Marina Bay and Marina South Pier on 21 Jul 2016
description: A train fault disrupted North-South Line service between Marina Bay and Marina South Pier in both directions. The incident occurred on Thursday around 7:45am during peak hour commute, resulting in delays of at least 20 minutes. Bus bridging services were activated.

incident: Train fault disrupted North-South Line service between City Hall and Joo Koon on 20 Jul 2016
description: A train fault disrupted East-West Line service between City Hall and Joo Koon in the westbound direction. The train fault occurred at Buona Vista station on Wednesday around 9am during peak hour commute, resulting in delays of at least 30 minutes.

incident: Track fault disrupted North-South Line service between Khatib and Bishan on 13 Jul 2016
description: A track fault disrupted North-South Line service between Khtaib and Bishan in both directions. The incident occurred on Wednesday at around 10:40am, resulting in delays of at least an hour. About 45 minutes after the incident started, the southbound service was recovered first, followed by the northbound service.

incident: Track fault disrupted North-South Line service between Woodlands and Ang Mo Kio on 29 Jun 2016
description: A track fault disrupted North-South Line service between Woodlands and Ang Mo Kio towards Marina Bay. The incident occurred on Wednesday at around 9:19pm, resulting in delays of at least 15 minutes. SMRT announced another delay an hour later, also caused by a track fault. It is unclear as to whether the two delays were related.

incident: Power fault disrupted North-South Line service between Woodlands and Sembawang on 23 Jun 2016
description: A power fault disrupted North-South Line service from Woodlands towards Sembawang on Thursday afternoon. The incident occurred at around 4:30pm, resulting in delays of at least 20 minutes. Free bus bridging services were activated.

incident: Power fault disrupted Punggol LRT service on 22 Jun 2016
description: Light Rail Transit (LRT) services were disrupted on the Punggol line for about an hour due to a power fault, transport provider SBS Transit said on Wednesday (Jun 22). SBS Transit announced the disruption on Twitter at about 5.50pm on Wednesday evening. Free bus services and bus bridging services are available, it added. The operator later tweeted an update saying that full service has resumed on Punggol LRT. In response to media queries, SBS Transit said full services resumed at 6.18pm, adding that it is investigating the cause of the fault. (CNA, 23 Jun 2016)

incident: Train fault disrupted Circle Line service between HarbourFront and Buona Vista on 16 Jun 2016
description: A train fault disrupted Circle Line service between HarbourFront and Buona Vista on Thursday morning. The incident occurred around 8am during the morning peak commute, resulting in delays of at least 10 minutes.

incident: Train fault disrupted Circle Line service between Caldecott and Farrer Road on 13 Jun 2016
description: A train fault disrupted Circle Line service between Caldecott and Farrer Road on Monday evening. The incident occurred around 6pm during the peak evening commute, resulting in delays of at least 30 minutes. SMRT only tweeted about the incident after train service had resumed.

incident: Power fault disrupted Punggol LRT service on 1 Jun 2016
description: The Punggol and Sengkang Light Rail Transit (LRT) lines resumed full service at 9.30pm on Wednesday evening (Jun 1), after 2.5 hours of downtime due to "power failure". Responding to media queries from Channel NewsAsia after the incident, SBS Transit CEO Gan Juay Kiat said the initial assessment showed the disruption was due to a suspected cable fault, which caused the system to have "repeated power trips". Mr Gan added that SBS Transit is investigating the cause of the fault and apologised to the affected commuters on behalf of the company. The disruption began at 7pm and SBS Transit first tweeted about the incident at 7.13pm. (CNA, 1 Jun 2016)

incident: Power fault disrupted Sengkang LRT service on 1 Jun 2016
description: The Punggol and Sengkang Light Rail Transit (LRT) lines resumed full service at 9.30pm on Wednesday evening (Jun 1), after 2.5 hours of downtime due to "power failure". Responding to media queries from Channel NewsAsia after the incident, SBS Transit CEO Gan Juay Kiat said the initial assessment showed the disruption was due to a suspected cable fault, which caused the system to have "repeated power trips". Mr Gan added that SBS Transit is investigating the cause of the fault and apologised to the affected commuters on behalf of the company. The disruption began at 7pm and SBS Transit first tweeted about the incident at 7.13pm. (CNA, 1 Jun 2016)

incident: Train fault disrupted North-South Line service between Yishun and Yio Chu Kang on 11 May 2016
description: An train fault disrupted North-South Line service between Yishun and Yio Chu Kang on Wednesday afternoon. The incident occurred around 4pm, resulting in delays of at least 40 minutes. Bus bridging services were activated.

incident: Train fault disrupted North-South Line service between Marina South Pier and Toa Payoh on 3 May 2016
description: Meanwhile, operator SMRT reported a train fault at Toa Payoh station along the North-South Line at 5.45pm, which delayed northbound service towards Jurong East. It told commuters via its Twitter feed to expect additional travelling time of 25 minutes from Marina South Pier to Toa Payoh. At about 6.15pm, it said service had resumed but added that trains may be moving more slowly due to the fault. (ST, 4 May 2016)

incident: Train fault disrupted Downtown Line service between Bukit Panjang and Sixth Avenue on 3 May 2016
description: The four-month-old Downtown Line 2 had its first major breakdown yesterday morning when a train inexplicably applied its emergency brakes. The fault happened at 11am and took around half an hour to resolve. Operator SBS Transit said at 6pm that it was still investigating why the emergency brakes were applied and why they could not be disengaged. The affected train, which held up services between Bukit Panjang and Sixth Avenue stations, was eventually removed. The disruption caused SBS Transit to deploy buses to ferry affected commuters. (ST, 4 May 2016)

incident: Unknown fault disrupted North-South Line service between Choa Chu Kang and Woodlands on 26 Apr 2016
description: An unknown fault disrupted North-South Line service between Choa Chu Kang and Woodlands on Tuesday morning. The incident occured during the morning peak hour commute at 6:31am. The delay lasted at least 18 minutes. Bus bridging services were activated. This breakdown occurred after the major disruption on Monday evening and SMRT is investigating whether it is related to last evening's disruption.

incident: Power fault disrupted Bukit Panjang LRT service on 25 Apr 2016
description: At 7.53pm, a power dip at Buona Vista power intake station caused a power trip which affected services on certain sections of the North-South and East-West Lines and the Circle Line, as well as the Bukit Panjang LRT network. A power intake station takes power supply from the Power Grid to power sections of the MRT network. There are five such power intake stations along the North-South and East-West Lines, as well as the Circle Line. The specific sectors affected on the East-West Line were Buona Vista to Joo Koon, on the North-South Line from Jurong East to Kranji, while on the Circle Line the stretch affected was from Caldecott to HarbourFront, in both directions. All affected stations were without power except for emergency lighting. Free bus services were activated at 8.15pm. Services on the North-South East-West Lines resumed at 8.23pm, maintaining an initial headway of 7 minutes, while services on the Circle Line resumed at 8.48pm. Four trains on the BPLRT were stalled between stations and 150 passengers were safely detrained. Services on the Bukit Panjang LRT resumed at 9.47pm. (SMRT press release)

incident: Power fault disrupted Circle Line service on 25 Apr 2016
description: At 7.53pm, a power dip at Buona Vista power intake station caused a power trip which affected services on certain sections of the North-South and East-West Lines and the Circle Line, as well as the Bukit Panjang LRT network. A power intake station takes power supply from the Power Grid to power sections of the MRT network. incident: Power fault disrupted East-West Line service on 25 Apr 2016
description: At 7.53pm, a power dip at Buona Vista power intake station caused a power trip which affected services on certain sections of the North-South and East-West Lines and the Circle Line, as well as the Bukit Panjang LRT network. incident: Power fault disrupted North-South Line service on 25 Apr 2016
description: At 7.53pm, a power dip at Buona Vista power intake station caused a power trip which affected services on certain sections of the North-South and East-West Lines and the Circle Line, as well as the Bukit Panjang LRT network. A power intake station takes power supply from the Power Grid to power sections of the MRT network. Four trains on the BPLRT were stalled between stations and 150 passengers were safely detrained. Services on the Bukit Panjang LRT resumed at 9.47pm. (SMRT press release)

incident: Train fault disrupted North-East Line service on 22 Apr 2016
description: A train fault disrupted North-East Line service on Friday morning. SBST first tweeted about the incident at 10:02am and service was fully recovered by 10:26am. Bus bridging services between HarbourFront and Chinatown were activated.

incident: Power fault disrupted North-East Line service between Outram Park and Farrer Park on 21 Apr 2016
description: Later on Thursday morning, the North-East Line was hit by a train disruption at 11.11am. According to an update on the Iris app, train services were unavailable between Chinatown and Farrer Park stations in both directions. According to a sign at an NEL station, SBS Transit said the disruption was due to a power fault at Dhoby Ghaut station. Services along the North-East Line resumed at 11.46am, according to SBS Transit. In response to media queries, SBS Transit said the power fault occurred just after 11am, and caused train services between Outram Park and Farrer Park stations to be disrupted. "Full service resumed about 40 minutes later," said SBS Transit's senior vice president for Corporate Communications Ms Tammy Tan. She added that the public transport operator is investigating the cause of the fault. (CNA, 21 Apr 2016)

incident: Train fault disrupted North-South Line service between Marina South Pier and Newton on 21 Apr 2016
description: At 6.09am, public transport operator SMRT sent out a tweet informing commuters that there was no train service from Marina South Pier station to Newton station in the direction of Jurong East due to a train fault. At 6.32am, SMRT sent out another tweet stating that train service from Raffles Place station to Marina South Pier station was unavailable, also due to a train fault. Train service from Marina South Pier to Newton towards Jurong East resumed at 6.53am, SMRT said, while service from Raffles Place to Marina South Pier resumed at 6.57am. In response to media queries, SMRT said the disruption was caused by a locomotive that stalled at Raffles Place. The locomotive is an engineering vehicle used for maintenance work. "A passenger train was activated to haul the faulty locomotive to Bishan Depot," said a spokesperson from SMRT, adding that the cause of the train fault is being investigated. This comes two days after the North-South Line passed the 100-day major incident-free milestone on Monday. (CNA, 21 Apr 2016)

incident: Train fault disrupted East-West Line service between Paya Lebar and Jurong East on 9 Apr 2016
description: A train fault disrupted East-West Line service between Paya Lebar and Jurong East towards Joo Koon on Saturday morning. The incident started at 9:53am and normal service was recovered 25 minutes later.

incident: Train fault disrupted Circle Line service between Dhoby Ghaut and Bishan on 8 Apr 2016
description: A train fault disrupted Circle Line service in both directions on Friday morning. The incident started at 7:27am during peak hour commute and normal service was recovered 10 minutes later. However trains and platforms remain crowded for at least 30 minutes after the incident started.

incident: Train fault disrupted Sengkang LRT service on 29 Mar 2016
description: A train fault disrupted train service on both the East and West loops of the Sengkang LRT on Tuesday evening. The incident started close to 8pm. Passengers were detrained from the faulty train near Renjong station and had to walk on the track in darkness to the station platform. There was at least 25 minutes of delay before normal train service was recovered. Bus bridging services were activated.

incident: Train fault disrupted North-East Line service on 24 Mar 2016
description: A train fault near Kovan station disrupted North-East Line service on Thursday evening. The incident started at about 7:15pm during peak hour commute. Train service resumed after 19 minutes. However, SBS Transit warned of delayed travelling times even though train service has resumed.

incident: Signalling fault disrupted North-East Line service on 24 Mar 2016
description: A signalling fault at HarbourFront station disrupted North-East Line service on Thursday morning. The incident started at about 8:31am during peak hour commute. Normal service was recovered after 19 minutes.

incident: Traction power fault disrupted East-West Line service between Joo Koon and Boon Lay on 22 Mar 2016
description: A traction power fault disrupted East-West Line service between Joo Koon and Boon Lay in both directions on Tuesday evening. The incident started at about 6:49pm during peak hour commute. Normal service was recovered after 15 minutes. Bus bridging services were activated and made available for an hour.

incident: Fatal accident disrupted East-West Line service between Tanah Merah and Pasir Ris on 22 Mar 2016
description: Two SMRT maintenance staff have died after an accident near Pasir Ris station, the transport operator confirmed on Tuesday (Mar 22). "At around 11.10am today, there was an accident involving two SMRT maintenance staff along the track at a servicing point near Pasir Ris station," said SMRT spokesman Patrick Nathan in a statement. "SCDF was immediately activated and they have confirmed that the two SMRT staff have passed away. We convey our deepest condolences to their families and will be providing support to them at this very difficult time," he said. "(They) were part of a technical team that went down to the track to investigate a reported alarm from a condition monitoring device for signalling equipment. Permission to access the track was authorised," said Mr Nathan. (CNA, 23 Mar 2016)

incident: Signalling fault disrupted Circle Line service between Kent Ridge and HarbourFront on 19 Mar 2016
description: A signalling fault disrupted Circle Line service between Kent Ridge and HarbourFront on Saturday evening. The incident started at about 7:54pm and normal service was recovered after 30 min.

incident: Signalling fault disrupted North-East Line service on 19 Mar 2016
description: Train service on the North-east Line (NEL) has resumed after a signalling fault caused a delay of about 20 minutes for commuters, SBS Transit said. It tweeted at 6.07pm on Saturday (March 19): "NEL full service has resumed. We are sorry for the inconvenience caused." SBS Transit said in an earlier tweet at 5.58pm that commuters travelling on the NEL would experience a 20-minute delay. The delay was due to a signalling fault at the Harbourfront station, the transport operator explained. (ST, 19 Mar 2016)

incident: North-South Line service disrupted at Bishan station on 18 Mar 2016
description: North-South Line service was disrupted at Bishan station on Friday afternoon. The incident started at about 2:30pm. SMRT did not report the cause of the incident nor made any public announcement on their social media channels.

incident: Track fault disrupted East-West Line service between Aljunied and Pasir Ris on 18 Mar 2016
description: The fault near Paya Lebar station, suspected to have been triggered by a works vehicle during the pre-dawn maintenance shift, lengthened travelling time by up to 30 minutes on the westbound track during the morning rush hours. Service was affected for nearly four hours, with normal service resuming only by 10.10am. Commuters tweeted about the train disruption from as early as 6.30am. Yesterday, SMRT had initially announced that journey times would take 15 minutes longer. It then progressively revised this to 20, 25 and finally, 30 minutes. The disruption affected thousands of commuters travelling during the morning commuting hours from 6.30am to around 9am. Checks carried out by The Straits Times found that neither trains nor stations between Aljunied and Raffles Place were packed from 9.30am. By around 9.40am, station announcements stated that the track fault had been rectified, but service was not up to speed yet because of congestion. Normal service resumed only by 10.10am. SMRT spokesman Patrick Nathan said the disruption was traced to a faulty track signal circuit. (ST, 19 Mar 2016)

incident: Track fault disrupted East-West Line service between Jurong East and Redhill on 8 Mar 2016
description: A track fault disrupted East-West Line service from Jurong East towards Redhill stations on Tuesday evening. The incident started at 5:29pm and normal service was recovered after 15 minutes.

incident: Train fault disrupted Circle Line service between Stadium and Dhoby Ghaut on 3 Mar 2016
description: A train fault disrupted Circle Line service in both directions between Stadium and Dhoby Ghaut/Marina Bay stations on Wednesday morning. The incident started at 11:39am and normal service was recovered after almost 45 minutes.

incident: Power fault disrupted Bukit Panjang LRT service on 26 Feb 2016
description: A power traction fault disrupted Bukit Panjang LRT service on Friday morning. The incident started at 05:30am and normal service was recovered after 10 minutes. Bus bridging was activated for almost an hour.

incident: Train fault disrupted East-West Line service between Joo Koon and Jurong East on 19 Feb 2016
description: A recurring train fault disrupted MRT service on the East-West Line during rush hour on Friday evening (Feb 19) between Jurong East and Joo Koon stations. SMRT first announced the fault at 5.43pm on Twitter and told commuters to expect an additional 15 minutes to their travelling time. Nearly 10 minutes later, it said the disruption was due to a train fault and to expect another 25 minutes on top of commuters' usual travelling time. By 6pm, the public transport operator announced there was no train service between Jurong East and Joo Koon, and that free bus bridging services were available. Two minutes later, it said service had resumed, but within 10 minutes, said commuters would take an extra 20 minutes for their journey due to the recurring fault. Free bus services were made available to affected commuters. At 6.36pm, SMRT tweeted that no train services were available between Jurong East to Joo Koon again, and that they were expected to resume in half an hour. The issue was resolved by 6.42pm, and services on both bounds were up and running again. (CNA, 19 Feb 2016)

incident: Track fault disrupted East-West Line service between Tanjong Pagar and Aljunied on 16 Feb 2016
description: A track fault disrupted East-West Line service between Tanjong Pagar and Aljunied towards Pasir Ris during peak hour commute on Tuesday evening. The incident started at 07:11pm and normal service was recovered after 34 minutes.

incident: Train fault disrupted North-South Line service between City Hall and Newton on 15 Feb 2016
description: A train fault near Dhoby Ghaut station disrupted North-South Line service between City Hall and Newton towards Jurong East during peak hour commute on Monday morning. The incident started at 09:20am and normal service was recovered after 16 minutes.

incident: Train fault disrupted North-East Line service on 10 Feb 2016
description: A train fault disrupted North-East Line service towards HarbourFront on Wednesday morning. The incident started at 10:55am and normal service was recovered after 10 minutes.

incident: Signalling fault disrupted East-West Line service between Outram Park and Jurong East on 28 Jan 2016
description: A train fault disrupted East-West Line service between Aljunied and Jurong East on Thursday during the morning peak hour commute. Gates were even closed at Boon Lay station due to overcrowding. The incident started at 8:03am and normal service was recovered half an hour later.

incident: Bukit Panjang LRT service B was disrupted on 22 Jan 2016
description: Bukit Panjang LRT Service B was disrupted for almost 5 hours on Friday morning during peak hour commute. Only Service A was available. Bus bridging was activated. According to eyewitnesses in a CNA report, a train came to a halt on the track between platforms and the door opened. Luckily, no one was standing near the door at the time. The in-train emergency phone was also not working. SMRT said it will be investigating the incident.

incident: Traction power fault disrupted North-South Line service between Woodlands and Kranji on 9 Jan 2016
description: A traction power fault disrupted North-South Line service on Saturday at about 5:47pm. Train service between Woodlands and Kranji were unavailable in both directions until normal service was recovered more than an hour later. Train services along other parts of the North-South Line network are unaffected with trains turning around at Admiralty and Kranji. Free bus and shuttle bus services are available between Admiralty and Kranji. Free bus bridging services ceased 40 minutes after normal service was recovered.

incident: Train fault disrupted Downtown Line service on 6 Jan 2016
description: A train fault on Wednesday morning peak commute caused a 11 minute delay on the Downtown Line service towards Chinatown.

incident: Signalling fault disrupted Downtown Line service on 31 Dec 2015
description: A door and signalling fault caused delays on the Downtown Line on Thursday (Dec 31) morning. Commuters had taken to social media to vent their frustrations, with some Twitter users complaining that they were stuck at a station for 15 minutes after train doors failed to close. Responding to queries from The Straits Times, Downtown Line operator SBS Transit said the problem at Botanic Gardens station was due to a door fault that prevented the train from closing its doors automatically. "This caused a delay of 15 minutes at 6.45am before regular service could resume," SBS Transit said. Meanwhile, a signalling fault on another train caused service along the line to slow down at about 7.35am, with commuters experiencing an additional travelling time of 15 minutes. Normal service eventually resumed at 8am, SBS Transit added. (ST, 31 Dec 2015)

incident: Door fault disrupted Downtown Line service on 31 Dec 2015
description: A door and signalling fault caused delays on the Downtown Line on Thursday (Dec 31) morning. Commuters had taken to social media to vent their frustrations, with some Twitter users complaining that they were stuck at a station for 15 minutes after train doors failed to close. Responding to queries from The Straits Times, Downtown Line operator SBS Transit said the problem at Botanic Gardens station was due to a door fault that prevented the train from closing its doors automatically. "This caused a delay of 15 minutes at 6.45am before regular service could resume," SBS Transit said. Meanwhile, a signalling fault on another train caused service along the line to slow down at about 7.35am, with commuters experiencing an additional travelling time of 15 minutes. Normal service eventually resumed at 8am, SBS Transit added. (ST, 31 Dec 2015)

incident: Track fault disrupted East-West Line service between Clementi and Joo Koon on 30 Dec 2015
description: For the second consecutive day, another track fault occurred on the same stretch of rail between Clementi and Joo Koon on the East-West Line. This resulted in a delay exceeding 1 hour during the morning peak commute but no bus briding services were activated.

incident: Signalling fault disrupted Downtown Line service on 29 Dec 2015
description: Commuters using the Downtown Line 2 (DTL2) to get to work yesterday morning found that there were delays on the new line. Mr Zhi Cong, 23, said the train he boarded at Bukit Panjang did not move out of the station for about eight minutes. "After the train reached Sixth Avenue, it was stuck again for another eight minutes," said Mr Zhi. Lawyer Lyv Meah, 37, said the platform doors failed to open at Rochor station, causing a delay. She added that the train she was on moved "slowly and jerkily" towards Bugis after the problem with the doors was rectified. SBS Transit's senior vice-president for corporate communications Tammy Tan said that slow service on the line was caused by a signalling fault at Rochor station at 9.10am yesterday. "The fault was rectified soon after and trains could resume their regular speed at about 9.18am," she added. (ST, 30 Dec 2015)

incident: Track fault disrupted East-West Line service between Clementi and Joo Koon on 29 Dec 2015
description: A track fault that occurred near Jurong East station caused a delay on the East-West Line on Tuesday (Dec 29) morning. Rail operator SMRT had first announced in a tweet at 8.41am to expect an additional 10 minutes in travelling time from Joo Koon to Clementi stations, in the direction of Pasir Ris. Normal service resumed more than an hour later at 9.57am (ST, 29 Dec 2015)

incident: Unexpectedly prolonged track maintenance disrupted North-South Line service between Yishun and Ang Mo Kio on 24 Dec 2015
description: On Thursday morning Christmas Eve, track maintanance work unintentionally slipped into revenue service hours, causing a 17-minute delay on the southbound train service between Yishun and Ang Mo Kio. Bus bridging services were activated.

incident: Power fault disrupted Sengkang and Punggol LRT service on 23 Dec 2015
description: There was no service on both Sengkang and Punggol LRT on Wednesday afternoon due to a power fault. The incident started at 2:04pm and normal service was recovered 13 minutes later. Bus bridging services were activated.

incident: Train fault disrupted East-West Line service between Bugis and Joo Koon on 21 Dec 2015
description: Due to a train fault near Tiong Bahru station, East-West Line service was disrupted between Bugis and Joo Koon on Monday morning. About 600 passengers have to be detrained from the affected train. SMRT first tweeted about the incident at 10:22am and normal service was restored 23 minutes later.

incident: Power fault disrupted East-West Line service between Joo Koon and Jurong East on 17 Dec 2015
description: A traction power trip has affected train services between Joo Koon and Boon Lay MRT stations. Joo Koon and Pioneer stations remain closed as our engineering staff work to resolve the fault. About 65 passengers aboard an eastbound train travelling from Joo Koon towards Pioneer were detrained close to Pioneer station. Train services are available from Pasir Ris to Boon Lay MRT station. Free bus services and shuttle buses are available between Joo Koon and Jurong East MRT stations. UPDATE at 10pm: The faulty train has been taken out of service. Normal train service resumed but shuttle buses and free bus service between Joo Koon and Jurong East stations were still available.

incident: Track fault disrupted Circle Line service between Promenade and Marina Bay on 10 Dec 2015
description: Circle Line service was disrupted between Promenade and Marina Bay on Thursday during peak morning commute. The delay was caused by a track fault and it lasted about 12 minutes.

incident: Unknown cause disrupted East-West Line service towards Pasir Ris on 10 Dec 2015
description: East-West Line service was disrupted in the eastbound direction on Thursday during peak morning commute. SMRT tweeted that the delay was "due to congestion at Pasir Ris" but did not explain why there was congestion. The delay lasted about 11 minutes.

incident: Track fault disrupted North-South Line service between Yishun and Sembawang on 1 Dec 2015
description: Track fault disrupted North-South Line service between Yishun and Sembawang on 1 Dec 2015

incident: Power fault disrupted North-South Line service between Yishun and Marina South Pier on 25 Nov 2015
description: An early morning power fault on the North South Line disrupted train services between Yishun and Bishan on Wednesday. Train service resumed at 8.11am. The delay began at 5.54am, according to SMRT’s Twitter account. SMRT also said free bus services were available from Yishun and Marina South Pier. SMRT also advised passengers traveling in the direction of Orchard and Marina South Pier to travel via Jurong East station. At 6.40am, media reports said fire engines were seen outside Ang Mo Kio MRT. Preliminary investigations indicate that a power breaker located at Ang Mo Kio MRT station was damaged. The exact cause of the incident is under investigation. Large crowds were seen at Bishan MRT station and at the bus stop opposite the station. Twiter users also sent in photos of crowds and long lines of commuters at Yishun MRT. SMRT activated free bus boarding and free shuttle service between Yishun and Marina South Pier stations, there was also an additional free shuttle bus service between Yishun and Bishan stations to cater to the peak south-bound demand. (Yahoo, 25 Nov 2015)

incident: Power fault disrupted Circle Line service on 25 Nov 2015
description: On Wednesday morning, a power fault disrupted Circle Line service. The incident started at 5:22am and traction power was restored 10 minutes later.

incident: Train fault disrupted North-South Line service between Yishun and Marina South Pier on 23 Nov 2015
description: A train fault disrupted North-South Line service between Yishun and Marina South Pier for 20 minutes. This happened on Monday morning during peak hour commute. Bus bridging services were activated, which lasted for an hour.

incident: Signalling fault disrupted Sengkang LRT service on 20 Nov 2015
description: A signalling fault disrupted Sengkang LRT service for almost an hour. This happened on Friday evening during peak hour commute. Bus bridging services were activated.

incident: Track fault disrupted Circle Line service between Dhoby Ghaut and Promenade on 12 Nov 2015
description: A track fault disrupted Circle Line service between Dhoby Ghaut and Promenade for about 15 minutes. This happened on Thursday morning during peak hour commute. Bus bridging services were activated.

incident: Train fault disrupted North-South Line service between Ang Mo Kio and Marina South Pier on 28 Oct 2015
description: SMRT was hit by two service disruptions on Wednesday (Oct 28), with the latest being a train fault at Braddell Station at evening rush hour. The transport operator tweeted at 7.17pm that commuters travelling should expect an additional 25-minutes travelling time on the North-South Line from Marina Bay to Ang Mo Kio. It also said that a free bus service was available for affected commuters, between Marina South Pier to Ang Mo Kio on both bounds. Normal service resumed at about 7.40pm. (CNA, 28 Oct 2015) --Although 'normal service' resumed at 7:40pm, trains were still travelling at a slower speed. SMRT tweeted at 8:33pm that "train services are now operating normally".

incident: Track fault disrupted East-West Line service between Tampines and Pasir Ris on 28 Oct 2015
description: On Wednesday afternoon, commuters on the East-West Line also experienced travel delays after due to a track fault. SMRT tweeted at 2.54pm that service between Pasir Ris and Tampines stations were halted for 20 minutes on both bounds. Service was restored at 3.10pm, but trains were travelling at a slower speed. Bus bridging services were activated and made available for 2 hours.

incident: Train fault disrupted North-South Line service between Marina Bay and Ang Mo Kio on 27 Oct 2015
description: A second train fault disrupted North-South Line service towards Jurong East during the evening peak commute on Tuesday. The first train fault occurred at 6:14pm and the second train fault occurred at 6:35pm. Normal train service resumed after 8 minutes.

incident: Train fault disrupted North-South Line service towards Jurong East on 27 Oct 2015
description: A train fault at Orchard station disrupted North-South Line service towards Jurong East during the evening peak commute on Tuesday. SMRT first tweeted about the delay at 6:14pm. Normal train service resumed after 8 minutes.

incident: Power fault disrupted North-East Line service on 26 Oct 2015
description: Train service was disrupted along the North East Line for nearly two hours on Monday (Oct 26) - from the start of service to the beginning of the morning peak - due to a power fault, said SBS Transit. No trains were running between Punggol and Harbourfront stations in both directions from 5.23am, when the transport operator first made the announcement on its Twitter account. At 7.21am, SBS Transit said service had resumed in both directions between Punggol and Harbourfront stations. Free bus rides and shuttle bus service were made available at designated stops along the line. Both SBS Transit and SMRT later said that free bus rides had been extended islandwide to all bus services. (CNA, 26 Oct 2015)

incident: Downtown Line service disrupted on 23 Oct 2015 (cause unknown)
description: Downtown Line service was disrupted during peak hour commute on Friday morning. SBS Transit first tweeted about the delay at 7:38am but the cause of the delay was not reported. At about the same time, SMRT's Circle Line was recovering from a train fault. Bus bridging services were activated.

incident: Train fault disrupted Circle Line service between Mountbatten and Paya Lebar on 23 Oct 2015
description: A train fault disrupted Circle Line service from Mountbatten towards Paya Lebar on Friday morning during peak hour commute. SMRT first tweeted about the delay at 6:49am. Normal train service resumed after half an hour. Bus bridging services were activated.

incident: Train fault disrupted East-West Line service between Clementi and Queenstown on 15 Oct 2015
description: A train fault disrupted East-West Line service Clementi and Queenstown in the eastbound direction on Thursday morning. Normal train service resumed half an hour after the incident started at 9:49am.

incident: Power fault disrupted North-East Line service on 13 Oct 2015
description: Commuters on the North East Line found themselves stranded on Tuesday morning (Oct 13) as a blackout stalled trains for more than half an hour. The power trip happened in the midst of morning rush hour at about 7.50am. At least four stations – Hougang, Kovan, Serangoon and Woodleigh – were hit by the blackout. Although normal train service resumed half an hour later, SMRT tweeted that there are still delays due to "trains being regulated". Bus bridging services were made available for 1.5 hours.

incident: Train fault disrupted East-West Line service between Outram Park and Jurong East on 9 Oct 2015
description: A train fault disrupted East-West Line service from Outram Park towards Jurong East on Friday morning. The incident started at 9:21am during peak hour commute. Normal train service resumed 16 minutes after the incident started.

incident: Train fault disrupted East-West Line service between Pioneer and Pasir Ris on 5 Oct 2015
description: A train fault at Pioneer station disrupted East-West Line service on Monday evening during peak hour commute. The incident started at around 6:13pm. Normal train service resumed 18 minutes after the incident started.

incident: Track fault disrupted North-South Line service between Khatib and Ang Mo Kio on 5 Oct 2015
description: A track fault disrupted North-South Line service from Ang Mo Kio to Khatib on Monday morning. The incident started at around 6:30am during peak hour commute. Normal train service resumed 47 minutes after the incident started.

incident: Track fault disrupted East-West Line service between Tanah Merah and Changi Airport on 30 Sep 2015
description: A track fault disrupted East-West Line service from Tanah Merah towards Changi Airport on Wednesday afternoon around 4:15pm. Bus bridging services were activated and made available for an hour. Normal train service resumed half an hour after the incident started.

incident: Train fault disrupted North-South Line service between Bukit Gombak and Jurong East on 27 Sep 2015
description: A train fault at Bukit Gombak delayed northbound train service towards Jurong East station on Sunday morning. The delay lasted about 10 minutes.

incident: Train fault disrupted North-South Line service between Yishun and Jurong East on 22 Sep 2015
description: A train fault at Yishun on the North-South line delayed journeys for commuters headed north towards Jurong East on Tuesday morning. SMRT sent a tweet at about 8.40am about the faulty train, and said train service towards Jurong would be delayed for 25 minutes. Eight minutes later, the public transport operator tweeted that service had resumed. It added that free bridging bus services between Ang Mo Kio and Sembawang stations were still available. (ST, 22 Sep 2015)

incident: North-East Line service disrupted between HarbourFront and Potong Pasir on 18 Sep 2015
description: No train services between HarbourFront and Potong Pasir stations on the North-East Line. The incident occurred on Friday morning at 6:30am during peak hour commute. Bus bridging services were activated between Outram Park and Potong Pasir stations. SBS Transit and LTA did not mention the delay on Twitter and Facebook.

incident: A second signalling fault disrupted North-East Line service on 8 Sep 2015
description: Train service on the North-East line was delayed for a second time on Tuesday morning (Sep 8) due to a signalling fault. The delay lasted for 2 hours and bus bridging services were activated.

incident: Signalling fault disrupted North-East Line service on 8 Sep 2015
description: Train service on the North-East line was delayed on Tuesday morning (Sep 8) due to a signalling fault at Sengkang station. At 7.19am, SBS Transit posted a tweet about the delay, telling commuters to expect additional travelling time of about 10 minutes. About 20 minutes later, it tweeted that free bus rides were available between Punggol and Farrer Park stations. At 7.54am, the transport operator said train service had resumed, but free buses were still running between the two stations. (CNA, 8 Sep 2015)

incident: Signalling fault disrupted North-East Line service on 7 Sep 2015
description: On Monday afternoon around 4:10pm, a signalling fault disrupted North-East Line service towards HarbourFront. The delay lasted 13 minutes.

incident: Track fault disrupted North-South Line service between Ang Mo Kio and Marina Bay on 13 Aug 2015
description: Train service on the North-South MRT line was delayed on Thursday (Aug 13) during the evening peak hour. At 6.32pm on Thursday, SMRT tweeted that commuters should expect an additional 10 minutes’ travelling time from Marina Bay to Ang Mo Kio, towards Jurong East. This was due to a track fault near Bishan, said the transport operator. In an update at 7.00pm, SMRT said commuters should expect an additional 15 minutes’ travelling time instead. Later in an update at 8.25pm, SMRT tweeted that train services were running normally. Commuters who were on the North South Line told Channel NewsAsia that the trains they were on repeatedly stalled between stations. (CNA, 13 Aug 2015)

incident: Track fault disrupted North-South Line service between Ang Mo Kio and Yishun on 13 Aug 2015
description: On Thursday morning around 5:30am, a track fault disrupted North-South Line service between Ang Mo Kio and Yishun. The delay lasted about 10 minutes. SMRT tweeted about the delay but there was no mention of the incident on their Facebook page.

incident: Train fault disrupted North-East Line service on 11 Aug 2015
description: North-East Line service was disrupted in the direction towards Punggol on Tuesday morning at around 10:40am. The delay lasted for at least 10 minutes. Both LTA and SBS Transit did not tweet about the delay, although LTA did send a notification via MyTransport app.

incident: North-South Line service disrupted between Choa Chu Kang and Jurong East on 11 Aug 2015 (cause unknown)
description: The North-South Line service was disrupted between Jurong East and Choa Chu Kang for at least 15 minutes on Tuesday morning. The incident occurred at around 7:30am during peak hour commute. SMRT did not tweet about the delay, nor was there any mention of the incident on their Facebook page.

incident: Train fault disrupted East-West Line service between Pasir Ris and Eunos on 7 Aug 2015
description: On Friday evening around 11:40pm, a train fault near Tanah Merah station disrupted East-West Line service between Pasir Ris and Eunos in the westbound direction. The delay lasted about 10 minutes. Bus bridging services were activated. SMRT tweeted about the delay but there was no mention of the incident on their Facebook page.

incident: Train fault near Marsiling station disrupted North-South Line service on 4 Aug 2015
description: Trains on the North-South line were delayed by up to six minutes on Tuesday (Aug 4) morning due to a train fault. At around 8.20am, passengers had to disembark from the affected train at Marsiling station, which was pulled out of service. This resulted in a build up of commuters waiting at station platforms along the North-South Line. Mr Patrick Nathan, SMRT Vice President for Corporate Information & Communications, said that trains were also travelling at reduced speeds due to the wet weather. (ST, 4 Aug 2015)

incident: Unknown fault disrupted East-West Line service on 31 Jul 2015
description: An unknown fault between the Bugis and the Tanah Merah MRT stations caused service delays along the East West Line and certain parts of the North-South Line during the peak hour on Friday. Transport operator, SMRT, which is in charge of these two lines, did not make any announcement on its social media platforms, neither were free bus services activated for the train disruption. (TOC, 1 Aug 2015)

incident: Signalling fault disrupted North-East Line service between Sengkang and Punggol on 28 Jul 2015
description: Train service on the North-East line was delayed for about 20 minutes in both directions on Tuesday evening due to a signalling fault. Service resumed at about 8.10pm.
