In a tweet at about 7.50pm, SBS Transit said that additional travel time of up to 15 minutes may be expected. In another tweet, the train operator apologised and said that service has resumed. It added that free bus services were available between Sengkang and Punggol. (ST, 28 Jul 2015)

incident: Train fault disrupted East-West Line service between Clementi and Joo Koon on 23 Jul 2015
description: A train fault caused a brief delay from Clementi to Joo Koon on the East-West Line on Thursday evening (July 23). Normal train services were resumed by 8.49pm, according to a post on train operator SMRT's Twitter account. SMRT had said in an earlier Twitter post that the travelling time from Clementi to Joo Koon station was expected to be delayed by about 20 minutes. The train operator also announced that it was offering free bus services between Jurong East and Joo Koon to affected commuters. (A1, 24 Jul 2015)

incident: Train fault disrupted North-South Line service on 21 Jul 2015
description: On Tuesday morning during peak hour commute, the North-South Line train service was delayed for at least an hour due to a train fault. Neither LTA nor SMRT made a public announcement of the incident on Twitter or their Facebook page.

incident: Train fault disrupted North-South Line service between Khatib and Yio Chu Kang on 16 Jul 2015
description: 5 minutes of additional travelling time between Khatib and Yio Chu Kang due to train fault. Incident occurred during peak morning commute around 8:55am. SMRT did not make any announcements on Twitter and Facebook. Notification of the delay was received via LTA's MyTransport app.

incident: Sengkang LRT service disrupted on 14 Jul 2015 but cause of delay unknown
description: Sengkang LRT East and West Loop services towards Sengkang were delayed during morning peak hour commute at around 8am. SBS Transit did not announce any delay on Twitter. The cause of delay is unknown.

incident: Following major disruption on 7 Jul 2015, North-South Line running at reduced speeds on 8 Jul 2015
description: Train service on the North-South and East-West Lines (NSEWL) will resume this morning (8 July 2015) at 5.30am but will operate at reduced speeds according to the following schedule. During operations, trains will arrive at average intervals of five to seven minutes. Commuters may also encounter intermittent short delays until the problems are definitively resolved and the system stabilised. SMRT will provide free travel for commuters exiting stations on the NSEWL until normal service resumes. Services on the NSL will be suspended for a few hours from 11am to allow LTA and SMRT engineers to conduct further investigations to determine the cause of the power trip that led to the shutdown of power across the entire network yesterday.

incident: Following major disruption on 7 Jul 2015, East-West Line running at reduced speeds on 8 Jul 2015
description: Train service on the North-South and East-West Lines (NSEWL) will resume this morning (8 July 2015) at 5.30am but will operate at reduced speeds according to the following schedule. During operations, trains will arrive at average intervals of five to seven minutes. Commuters may also encounter intermittent short delays until the problems are definitively resolved and the system stabilised. SMRT will provide free travel for commuters exiting stations on the NSEWL until normal service resumes. Services on the NSL will be suspended for a few hours from 11am to allow LTA and SMRT engineers to conduct further investigations to determine the cause of the power trip that led to the shutdown of power across the entire network yesterday.

incident: North-South Line running at reduced speeds after major disruption on 7 Jul 2015
description: Train service on the NSEWL resumed after major disruption on 7 Jul 2015 but running at reduced speeds. Free bus services are still available.

incident: East-West Line running at reduced speeds after major disruption on 7 Jul 2015
description: Train service on the NSEWL resumed after major disruption on 7 Jul 2015 but running at reduced speeds. Free bus services are still available.

incident: Power fault resulted in no train service on both North-South and East-West Lines on 7 Jul 2015
description: Train service on the North-South and East-West lines resumed after an outage that lasted at least 3.5 hours during the evening rush hour on Tuesday (Jul 7). At about 7.15pm, SMRT tweeted that commuters should expect an additional 20 minutes’ travelling time between Clementi and Joo Koon, as well as between Marina Bay and Yishun, due to a traction power fault. Subsequently, commuters reported that trains had stalled, and the lights and air-conditioning had gone off. Train service in both directions on the East-West Line resumed at about 9.20pm, while service on North-South Line resumed at 10.35pm, said SMRT. However, the trains would be travelling at slower speeds on both networks, the operator added. (CNA, 7 Jul 2015)

incident: Power fault resulted in no train service on both North-South and East-West Lines on 7 Jul 2015
description: Train service on the North-South and East-West lines resumed after an outage that lasted at least 3.5 hours during the evening rush hour on Tuesday (Jul 7). At about 7.15pm, SMRT tweeted that commuters should expect an additional 20 minutes’ travelling time between Clementi and Joo Koon, as well as between Marina Bay and Yishun, due to a traction power fault. Subsequently, commuters reported that trains had stalled, and the lights and air-conditioning had gone off. Train service in both directions on the East-West Line resumed at about 9.20pm, while service on North-South Line resumed at 10.35pm, said SMRT. However, the trains would be travelling at slower speeds on both networks, the operator added. (CNA, 7 Jul 2015)

incident: Train fault disrupted Sengkang LRT service near Thanggam on 4 Jul 2015
description: 13-minute delay of Sengkang LRT West loop service due to train fault near Thanggam at around 2pm on Saturday. SBS Transit did not report this incident on Twitter or Facebook page

incident: Track fault disrupted NSL service between Choa Chu Kang and Toa Payoh on 3 Jul 2015
description: Train service was delayed on Friday morning (Jul 3) along the North South Line due to a track fault, said transport operator SMRT. Commuters travelling from Choa Chu Kang to Admiralty, towards Marina Bay, should factor in an additional 15 minutes of travelling time, SMRT said in a Twitter post at 7.55am. Free bus services had been activated between the affected stations of Yew Tee and Toa Payoh, it said. Fifteen minutes later, it posted another tweet saying that the expected additional travelling time was 25 minutes. At 9.25am, the transport operator said that normal train services had resumed, and that it was ceasing the free bus services. SMRT later said in a statement that the track circuit fault happened between Woodlands and Admiralty stations, resulting in trains slowing down in both directions. (CNA, 3 Jul 2015)

incident: Train fault disrupted NEL service on 18 Jun 2015
description: On Thursday morning, a train fault occurred on the North-East Line around 9am. Normal service resumed after 15 minutes. SBS Transit sent alerts via SMS but no announcements were made on Twitter.

incident: Power fault disrupted NEL service on 17 Jun 2015
description: On Wednesday evening during peak hour commute, North-East Line service was delayed in both directions when a power fault occurred around 7pm. Free passing bus rides were activated between Farrer Park and Hougang stations. Normal service resumed after half an hour. SBS Transit sent alerts via SMS and Twitter.

incident: Train fault disrupted train service between Marina Bay and Marina South Pier on 15 Jun 2015
description: On Monday around 11:40am, a train fault occurred near Marina Bay station. As a result, North-South Line service was not available between Marina Bay and Marina South Pier. Bus bridging services were activated. Normal service resumed after 36 minutes. SMRT made announcements on Twitter but no explanation was put up on their Facebook page.

incident: Train fault near Bishan disrupted train service between Yishun and Toa Payoh on 15 May 2015
description: On Friday afternoon around 4pm, a train fault occurred near Bishan. As a result, train service was delayed between Yishun and Toa Payoh on the North-South Line. Bus bridging services were activated. Normal service resumed after 10 minutes. SMRT made announcements on Twitter but no explanation was put up on their Facebook page.

incident: Power fault disrupted train service in Sengkang LRT West loop on 8 May 2015
description: More than one train stuck, at least two on the track and one at Layar platform. Passengers were required to detrain on the track. Free boarding of passing by buses from Sengkang, but no additional shuttle buses were activated. SBS Transit and LTA did not make any announcements on Twitter. Incident seemed to have started around 5pm and full service was not restored until the end of revenue service (12:30am).

incident: Train fault disrupted train service between Pending and Bangkit on 28 Apr 2015
description: Following a power fault that occurred an hour earlier, a train fault disrupted train service between Pending and Bangkit on the Bukit Panjang LRT. Shuttle buses and free bus services that were activated during the earlier power fault were still available. The incident started at around 9:15pm and normal service resumed after 20 minutes. SMRT made announcements on Twitter but no explanation was put up on their Facebook page.

incident: Power fault disrupted train service on the Bukit Panjang LRT on 28 Apr 2015
description: On Tuesday evening during peak hour commute, a power fault disrupted all train services on the Bukit Panjang LRT. At about 7:06pm, a two-car train on the Bukit Panjang LRT stalled between Phoenix (BP5) and Bukit Panjang (BP6) stations after a power trip. The power trip affected trains throughout the LRT system. Recovery efforts were launched immediately to restore service and ensure passengers aboard the affected train were attended to as quickly as possible. Recovery efforts were slowed down by heavy rain and lightning. Our staff assisted passengers to detrain safely. Shuttle buses and free bus services were activated. Normal service resumed after one and a half hours. Although the incident started at 7:06pm, SMRT only sent out its first tweet 26 minutes later, at 7:32pm.

incident: Power fault disrupted train service on the Sengkang LRT East Loop on 20 Apr 2015
description: The Sengkang LRT East Loop train service was disrupted briefly on Monday afternoon. The Land Transport Authority (LTA) tweeted at 2.21pm: "No #Sengkang LRT East Loop train service. Free bus rides avail at designated bus stops." The train service resumed shortly after, but the free bus rides are still available, LTA said. Ms Tammy Tan, senior vice-president of corporate communications at SBS Transit, said that the train service was disrupted "due to a power fault". She added that full service resumed less than half an hour later, and that affected commuters were able to continue their journey on shuttle buses. " We apologise to affected commuters for the inconvenience caused. Meanwhile, we are investigating the incident," she said. (ST, 20 Apr 2015)

incident: Track fault disrupted service between Yishun and Jurong East on 15 Apr 2015
description: On Wednesday morning during peak hour commute, a track fault near Kranji disrupted train service from Yishun to Jurong East on the North-South Line. The incident started at around 8:50am. Normal service resumed after 25 minutes. SMRT made announcements on Twitter but no explanation was put up on their Facebook page.

incident: Signalling fault disrupted service between Buangkok and Punggol on 13 Apr 2015
description: On Monday afternoon, a signalling fault disrupted train service in both directions on the North-East Line between Buangkok and Punggol stations. The incident started at around 4:05pm but the first SMS alert only went out at 4:19pm. Bus bridging services were activated and made available for an hour. Normal service resumed after 45 minutes.

incident: Signalling fault disrupted service between Bishan and Dhoby Ghaut on 13 Apr 2015
description: Commuters on the Circle Line during Monday morning's rush hour were inconvenienced after a train before Tai Seng station (towards Dhoby Ghaut station) suffered a nine-minute delay at around 7.47am. Responding to queries from The Straits Times, SMRT's Vice-President for Corporate Information and Communications, Patrick Nathan, said: "Due to a signalling fault, the train had applied its emergency brakes as part of its safety mechanism." Mr Nathan said station staff were immediately deployed to the affected train and manually operated it towards Paya Lebar station, where passengers alighted to continue their journey. (ST, 13 Apr 2015)

incident: Train service disrupted on the North-South Line on 10 Apr 2015
description: On Friday morning during peak-hour commute, train service was disrupted at some stations on the North-South Line. The affected stations and the cause of the delay were not reported. The incident started at around 6:36am. Normal service resumed after 15 minutes. SMRT made announcements on Twitter but no explanation was put up on their Facebook page.

incident: Train fault disrupted service on the Bukit Panjang LRT on 30 Mar 2015
description: On Monday evening during peak-hour commute, Services A and C of the Bukit Panjang LRT were not running due to a train fault. The incident started at around 7:20pm. Bus bridging services were not activated despite detrainment on the track near South View station. Normal service resumed after an hour. SMRT made announcements on Twitter but no explanation was put up on their Facebook page.

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Bugis and Aljunied on 27 Mar 2015
description: On Friday evening during peak-hour commute, a train fault near Lavender station resulted in no train service on the East West Line between Bugis and Aljunied. The incident started at around 5:50pm. Bus bridging services were activated. Normal service resumed after 45 minutes. SMRT made announcements on Twitter but no explanation was put up on their Facebook page.

incident: Track fault disrupted service between Tampines and Pasir Ris on 23 Mar 2015
description: On Monday evening during peak-hour commute, train services were delayed on the East-West Line between Tampines and Pasir Ris due to a track fault. The incident started at around 7:30pm. Bus bridging services were activated. Normal service resumed after almost 2 hours. SMRT made announcements on Twitter but no explanation was put up on their Facebook page.

incident: Track fault disrupted service between Choa Chu Kang and Kranji on 18 Mar 2015
description: On Wednesday afternoon at around 2:30pm, train services were delayed on the North-South Line between Choa Chu Kang and Kranji due to a track fault. Normal service resumed after 40 minutes. SMRT made announcements on Twitter but no explanation was put up on their Facebook page.

incident: Power fault disrupted service on the North-East Line on 18 Mar 2015
description: On Wednesday morning at around 9:50am, a power fault resulted in no train service between Punggol and HarbourFront for 50 minutes. It is unclear whether bus bridging services were activated. SBS Transit only alerted the public through their Iris app after normal service has resumed. There were no official updates on social media because the company does not have a Facebook page and its Twitter account is inactive.

incident: Track inspection delayed service between Jurong East and Kranji on 13 Mar 2015
description: On Friday afternoon at 4:29pm, train services were delayed momentarily on the North-South Line between Jurong East and Kranji when an ad-hoc track inspection was conducted near Yew Tee station. Normal service resumed after 5 minutes. SMRT made announcements on Twitter but the reason for the track inspection was not put up on their Facebook page.

incident: Signalling fault disrupted service on the North-South Line on 12 Mar 2015
description: On Thursday afternoon at about 3:36pm, train services on the North-South Line were delayed when a train stalled at Yishun station due to a signalling fault. Normal service resumed after an hour. SMRT did not make any announcements on Twitter but an acknowledgement of the incident was posted on their Facebook page hours later.

incident: Mishap at Hougang station disrupted service on the North-East Line on 11 Mar 2015
description: A student’s leg got trapped in a platform gap at Hougang MRT station early Wednesday (11 March), causing a delay in service on the North East Line (NEL). The incident happened just before 8am and the Singapore Civil Defence Force (SCDF) was alerted to the situation. According to the SCDF, SBS Transit staff and members of the public pulled the student out before they arrived at the scene. The student was sent to Tan Tock Seng Hospital with no serious injuries. In a statement on Wednesday, Ms Tammy Tan, senior vice-president of Corporate Communications at NEL operator SBS Transit said that the female commuter had "slipped and caught her left leg in the 10cm gap" between the platform and train. "As a result of this incident, the train was held back at the station, causing service to be delayed on the line. Public address announcements were made to inform commuters about the delay,” she added. The crowds dispersed by 9:30am, but no notice of the train delays were posted on social media by SBS Transit, which operates the North East Line. (Yahoo, 11 Mar 2015)

incident: Electrical fire at Senja station disrupted service on the Bukit Panjang LRT on 9 Mar 2015
description: Services along the Bukit Panjang LRT will be suspended until Tuesday morning, following an electrical room fire at Senja station on Monday evening (Mar 9). In a statement on Facebook at about 7pm, SMRT said: "Power tie-breakers at Senja station were damaged. Services on the BPLRT will not resume this evening. We are working to recover service by tomorrow morning and are investigating the cause of the incident. Free bus and bus bridging services will continue. We ask commuters to seek alternative transport options." The public transport operator first announced that there would be no train services in both directions at 6.01pm. Public and shuttle buses are available at affected stations, it added. The Singapore Civil Defence Force (SCDF) told Channel NewsAsia that it received a call at 5.47pm about a fire, and sent a fire engine, three Red Rhinos, two fire bikes, an ambulance, and four support vehicles to Senja station. SCDF said the fire involved a circuit breaker inside the electrical room, and was put out with a fire extinguisher. No one was injured, and there was no evacuation, SCDF said. The cause of the fire is under investigation, it added. (CNA, 9 Mar 2015)

incident: Train service disrupted on the Bukit Panjang LRT from Bukit Panjang to Senja on 8 Mar 2015
description: On Sunday evening at about 9:45pm, train services on the Bukit Panjang LRT were disrupted for 20 minutes from Bukit Panjang to Senja via Petir. Service A was unaffected (from Bukit Panjang to Petir via Senja). Cause of the delay was unreported. SMRT tweeted about the delay but did not put any explanation on their Facebook page.

incident: Signal fault disrupted service between Kent Ridge and HarbourFront on 6 Mar 2015
description: On Friday morning during peak hour commute, train services were disrupted for 10 minutes between Kent Ridge and HarbourFront due to a signal fault. The incident started at 6:53am. SMRT tweeted about the delay but did not put any explanation on their Facebook page.

incident: Track fault disrupted service between Tanjong Pagar and Jurong East on 3 Mar 2015
description: On Tuesday evening during peak hour commute, train services along the East West Line were disrupted for one and a half hours due to a track fault near Clementi station. The incident started at 5:35pm. At 5.49pm, SMRT tweeted that free bus services have been activated between Boon Lay and Queenstown in both directions. At 6.51pm, SMRT said on Twitter that trains between Queenstown and Boon Lay stations would be travelling slower as a result of the track fault. Train services resumed at 7.08pm. Free bus services were made available for 2 hours.

incident: Signal fault disrupted service between Pasir Panjang and HarbourFront on 3 Mar 2015
description: On Tuesday morning during peak hour commute, a signal fault occurred on the Circle Line at 7:30am. This resulted in no train service between Pasir Panjang and HarbourFront in both directions. Although train service was restored after 40 minutes, the delay, compounded with morning commuter crowds, saw larger-than-usual crowds at other train stations along the Circle Line. Serangoon MRT Station was so crowded that commuters were temporarily barred from taking the escalator down to the platform to ease congestion. Bus bridging services were activated and made available for half an hour. SMRT tweeted about the delay 20 minutes after the incident started. SMRT also did not put up any explanation on their Facebook page.

incident: Track intrusion disrupted service between Yew Tee and Jurong East on 27 Feb 2015
description: Train services along the North South Line were disrupted tonight (Feb 27) for more than 90 minutes after a man intruded onto the tracks twice. The man was seen walking on the viaduct between Chua Chu Kang and Bukit Gombak stations at about 8.45pm, SMRT said on its Facebook page. “As a safety precaution, SMRT staff proceeded to immediately stop train services to investigate the alleged track intrusion,” SMRT said. At about 9.30pm, SMRT tweeted that trains were running normally but within 15 minutes, tweeted again that there would be no train service between Bukit Gombak and Yew Tee in both directions as the man had intruded onto the tracks again. The operator later announced that there would be no train service between Jurong East and Yew Tee in both directions, as it investigated the track intrusion. Free bus services were activated between Jurong East and Yew Tee. Train services resumed around 10.30pm, albeit at slower speeds. Normal train services resumed about 20 minutes later, according to SMRT’s updates on Twitter. (TODAY, 28 Feb 2015)

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Bukit Panjang and Choa Chu Kang on 24 Feb 2015
description: On Tuesday 12pm, a train fault on the Bukit Panjang LRT resulted in no train service between Bukit Panjang and Choa Chu Kang. Loop service between Senja and Petir was unaffected. Train service resumed more than an hour later. Bus bridging services were activated and made available for 1.5 hours. SMRT first tweeted about the incident at 12:18 pm but only made public announcements on Facebook 50 minutes later.

incident: Defective third rail disrupted service between Yew Tee and Kranji on 23 Feb 2015
description: On Monday 3pm, a train was stalled due to a damaged third rail which supplies power to the trains. This resulted in no train service between Yew Tee and Kranji. Train service resumed after 4.5 hours, with speed restrictions imposed. Bus bridging services were activated and made available till 8pm. SMRT first tweeted about the incident at 3pm but only made public announcements on Facebook half an hour later.

incident: Signalling fault disrupted service between HarbourFront and Potong Pasir on 18 Feb 2015
description: MRT service on the North East Line (NEL) was suspended for about 40 minutes on Wednesday night (Feb 18) due to a signalling fault, SBS Transit announced. At 10.45pm, the Land Transport Authority tweeted on behalf of SBS Transit that service was delayed due to the fault and that commuters should expect additional travel time of up to 10 minutes. By 11.09, service between HarbourFront and Potong Pasir was suspended, with about nine stations affected including Chinatown, where thousands are for Chinese New Year festivities. About 15 minutes later, SBS announced that service between Outram Park and Potong Pasir was still not up and running and that free bus rides were available at designated bus stops near affected stations. By 11.50pm, service had resumed, but commuters were told to expect additional travelling time of up to 15 minutes. (CNA, 19 Feb 2015)

incident: Train fault at Jurong East disrupted service between Joo Koon and Clementi on 17 Feb 2015
description: On Tuesday morning, a train fault disrupted eastbound service between Joo Koon and Clementi. The incident started at 11:11am and train service was restored after 30 minutes. Bus bridging services were activated and made available for half an hour. SMRT tweeted about the delay but did not put up any explanation on their Facebook page.

incident: Train service disrupted on the North-East Line towards HarbourFront on 9 Feb 2015
description: On Monday morning during peak-hour commute, train service on the NEL towards HarbourFront was delayed. The incident started at about 8am. It is unknown when the delay ended. SBS Transit did not send a SMS broadcast to inform the public about the delay. There were no official updates on social media because the company does not have a Facebook page and its Twitter account is inactive.

incident: Power fault disrupted service between Little India and Punggol on 8 Feb 2015
description: On Sunday evening, a power fault disrupted train services between Little India and Punggol in both directions. The incident started at about 6:25pm. It is unknown when the delay ended. SBS Transit did not send a SMS broadcast to inform the public about the delay. There were no official updates on social media because the company does not have a Facebook page and its Twitter account is inactive.

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Marina South Pier and City Hall on 3 Feb 2015
description: On Tuesday morning during peak hour commute, a train fault disrupted train services between City Hall and Marina South Pier in both directions. The incident started at 7:06am. At 7:28am, train service resumed from City Hall to Marina Bay but there was still no train service between Marina Bay and Marina South Pier. It took 50 minutes before train service was completely restored. Bus bridging services were activated and made available for more than an hour. SMRT tweeted about the delay but did not put up any explanation on their Facebook page.

incident: Track fault disrupted service between Sembawang and Yio Chu Kang on 30 Jan 2015
description: On Friday morning, a track fault disrupted train services from Sembawang to Yio Chu Kang towards Marina Bay. The incident started at 9:51am and lasted nearly 50 minutes. Bus bridging services were activated and made available for 1 hour. SMRT tweeted about the delay but did not put up any explanation on their Facebook page. SMRT had mistakenly tweeted that the fault was cleared even though the train was not moving.

incident: Track fault disrupted service between Bishan and Ang Mo Kio on 23 Jan 2015
description: On Friday morning, a track fault disrupted train services from Bishan to Ang Mo Kio. The incident started at 5:37am and lasted for 12 minutes. SMRT tweeted about the delay but did not put up any explanation on their Facebook page.

incident: Defective third rail disrupted service between Admiralty and Yishun on 19 Jan 2015
description: On Monday afternoon, the third rail, which supplies power to the trains, was found to be defective between Admiralty and Yishun. As a result, train services were disrupted from Admiralty to Yishun in both directions. The incident started at 3:20pm and lasted for 10 minutes. Bus bridging services were activated.

incident: Train fault at Chinese Garden disrupted service between Tanah Merah and Joo Koon on 14 Jan 2015
description: On Wednesday morning during peak-hour commute, passengers were forced to detrain at Chinese Garden station because train door was jammed by small pieces of jewellery (1 earrings and 2 beads). This incident disrupted service between Joo Koon and Tanah Merah stations in both directions. The jammed doors somehow caused the trains to be stalled near Lakeside for about 20 minutes. The disruption started at about 7:55am and lasted for more than an hour. Hours after the incident, SMRT posted an update on their Facebook page regarding the incident. SMRT did not make any announcements via Twitter.

incident: Power fault disrupted service between Serangoon and HarbourFront on 23 Dec 2014
description: SMRT said in a statement that at 9.05am, a train travelling between Holland Village towards Buona Vista had stalled, causing a power trip between Holland Village and Harbourfront in both directions. At about 9.17am, SMRT Singapore tweeted that commuters travelling between Serangoon and Buona Vista towards Harbour Front should expect an additional 10 mins travelling time. "The power was progressively restored and completed at 9.23am," they said. Train services towards Harbourfont then resumed at 9.27am. Train operations reached normal operation at 10.02am, tweeted SMRT. (CNA, 23 Dec 2014)

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Joo Koon and Jurong East on 11 Dec 2014
description: On Thursday morning during peak-hour commute, a train fault disrupted service between Joo Koon and Jurong East stations in both directions. Free bus bridging service was activated. The disruption started at about 7:42am and lasted for 9 minutes.

incident: Signalling fault disrupted service between one-north and HarbourFront on 30 Nov 2014
description: On Sunday afternoon at 4:47pm, a signalling fault delayed Circle Line service between one-north and HarbourFront stations. Although the fault was cleared in 8 minutes, trains and platforms remain crowded for almost half an hour. SMRT tweeted about the incident but did not put up any information on their Facebook page.

incident: Power fault disrupted North-East Line service on 25 Nov 2014
description: On Tuesday evening at around 9pm, a power fault delayed North-East Line service in both directions. Commuters on the platform were advised that there would be an additional 10 minutes of travel time. Apparently, a train was stuck at Little India station. It is unknown how long service was actually delayed or when normal service resumed. SBS Transit did not inform the public through their SMS broadcast or Twitter account. SBS Transit does not have a Facebook page.

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Paya Lebar and Dhoby Ghaut on 13 Nov 2014
description: On Thursday morning at 10:14am, a train fault delayed Circle Line service towards Dhoby Ghaut for about 15 minutes. SMRT tweeted about the incident but did not put up any information on their Facebook page.

incident: Power fault disrupted service between Kent Ridge and HarbourFront on 4 Nov 2014
description: At around 4:30pm on Tuesday afternoon, the train broke down in the tunnel before Pasir Panjang station. It is unclear whether passengers were made to evacuate or the train towed to the next station. The disruption lasted about half an hour and affected service in both directions. SMRT tweeted about the incident but did not put up any information on their Facebook page.

incident: Track fault disrupted service between Admiralty and Kranji on 31 Oct 2014
description: A track fault disrupted service between Admiralty and Kranji stations in both directions on Friday afternoon. The disruption started at about 3:54pm and lasted for 22 minutes. According to SMRT's tweet, the track fault may have been caused by lightning.

incident: Train fault at Ang Mo Kio station disrupted North-South Line service on 29 Oct 2014
description: A train fault at Ang Mo Kio station delayed North-South Line service during peak hour commute on Wednesday morning at around 7am. Some stations took the safety precaution of temporarily disabling the escalators as crowds built up on the platforms. Although there were in-station announcements on the service disruption, there was no mention nor the cause reported on SMRT's Facebook page and Twitter.

incident: Train service delayed between Outram Park and Joo Koon on 21 Oct 2014
description: The East West Line service from Outram Park to Joo Koon was delayed during peak hour commute on Tuesday morning at around 7:25am. Although there were in-station announcements on the service disruption, there was no mention nor the cause reported on SMRT's Facebook page and Twitter.

incident: Train door fault at Dhoby Ghaut station disrupted service between Marina Bay and Newton on 15 Oct 2014
description: A train door fault occurred at Dhoby Ghaut station at 5pm on Wednesday afternoon. SMRT initially estimated a 15-minute delay but it eventually grew to a 1-hour delay in train service between Marina Bay and Newton in both directions. "A Channel NewsAsia producer on the scene said almost all doors on both sides of the platform were not operating normally, and that commuters had to prise open the platform doors to exit." (CNA, 15 Oct 2014)

incident: Power fault disrupted service along the North-East Line on 29 Sep 2014
description: A power fault occurred on the North-East Line at around 9:30am during peak-hour commute on Monday morning. This caused a 1-hour delay before full train service resumed. SBS Transit broadcasted this incident via their SMS alert service.

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Yio Chu Kang and Marina Bay on 29 Sep 2014
description: A train fault occurred on the North-South Line at around 9am during peak-hour commute on Monday morning. This caused a 30-minute delay on the southbound train service from Yio Chu Kang towards Marina Bay.

incident: Power fault disrupted service on the Sengkang West LRT on 24 Sep 2014
description: Peak-hour commute on the Sengkang West LRT was disrupted on Wednesday morning since 7:30am. Free bus bridging services were activated. Service resumed at around 8am and bus bridging was ceased at 8:30am. This incident was announced on SBS Transit's SMS alert service, but there was no account of this incident on their website.

incident: Train fault at Somerset station disrupted service between Marina Bay and Newton on 23 Sep 2014
description: At around 8.40pm on Tuesday evening, two defective trains were unable to depart Somerset station. As a result train services between Marina Bay and Newton both bounds were affected. Engineers were immediately deployed on site while free bus services and bus bridging were made available. At around 10.30pm, both defective trains were recovered. Services resumed at 10.40pm, while free bus services and bus bridging remain available. After the apparent service recovery, however, trains were travelling slower from Marina Bay to Bishan north bound, according to SMRT's tweet at 10:47pm. Bus bridging ceased at 11:30pm.

incident: Train fault at Redhill station disrupted service between Outram Park and Queenstown on 19 Sep 2014
description: Train services on the East-West Line were delayed by up to 40 minutes on Friday afternoon. SMRT tweeted at 1.38pm that this was due to a "train fault" at Redhill MRT station. A second update on SMRT's Facebook page at 2.16pm said that normal services had been restored. Free bus services were provided between Outram Park and Queenstown MRT stations to transport affected commuters. Free bus services ceased at 2:30pm.

incident: Signalling fault at Newton station disrupted service between Toa Payoh and Marina Bay on 13 Sep 2014
description: SMRT first tweeted about the incident at 3:42pm. The delay lasted about 20 minutes and affected service in both directions.

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Toa Payoh and Marina Bay on 1 Sep 2014
description: Commuters taking the North-South line from Toa Payoh to Marina Bay experienced a delay of about 30 minutes on Monday night as a result of a faulty train. An operational train had to be deployed to "push out" a defective one from Novena to Newton MRT stations, said train operator SMRT. SMRT had sent out an alert on Twitter at 9.44pm to notify the public about the faulty train. About half an hour later, at 10.16pm, SMRT announced that normal service had resumed on the affected line. But when The Straits Times visited Novena station after train services resumed, the trains were still crowded. (ST, 1 Sep 2014) --Bus bridging services were also activated and ceased at about 10:40pm.

incident: Signalling fault at Braddell station disrupted North-South Line service on 27 Aug 2014
description: A total of three incidents caused the delay on Wednesday morning. The first two incidents were short delays resulting from passengers' activation of the emergency communications button (ECB). "A third incident took place at 8.03am. A train encountered a signalling fault and travelled on manual mode at slower speed until it reached Braddell, where passengers were asked to detrain and board the next train to continue with their journey. We sent an empty train on the southbound track to Braddell to help clear platform congestion caused by the detrainment. Our engineers are investigating the cause of the signal fault." (SMRT's Facebook post, 27 Aug 2014)

incident: Power fault disrupted service between Sengkang and Punggol on 21 Aug 2014
description: North East Line service between Punggol (NE17) and Sengkang (NE16) stations was disrupted earlier today due to a power fault. The disruption started just slightly after 6.00am this morning and full service resumed at about 3.00pm. The disruption was caused by the dislocation of two pairs of steady arms holding the contact wire of the Overhead Catenary System power supply line at the crossover between the North and South tunnels near Punggol. This is the first time that the steady arms have dislodged. As a result, power supply between Punggol (NE17) and Sengkang (NE16) was cut. Service continued to run between Buangkok (NE15) and HarbourFront (NE1). During the disruption, to enable commuters to continue on their journey between Punggol (NE17) and Sengkang (NE16) stations, close to 40 shuttle buses were in operation. Commuters were also able to board passing bus services for free at designated bus stops at the affected stations. More than 70 Goodwill Ambassadors and Traffic Inspectors were at the affected stations to assist commuters. We deeply apologise to some 18,000 passengers who were affected by the disruption. (SBS Transit's media statement)

incident: Signalling fault disrupted service between Tai Seng and HarbourFront on 8 Aug 2014
description: A Circle Line train stalled between Tai Seng and Bartley stations at 8.05am on Friday (Aug 8), causing major crowds at Bishan and Serangoon stations and affecting the service intervals between trains toward Harbourfront station for about an hour. In a statement on its official Facebook page, SMRT said: "The stalled train was driven by a Station Staff to Bartley, where passengers were detrained. Our commuters resumed their journey on the next trains." While full services along the Circle Line resumed at around 8.14am, the stalled train meant further delays to trains behind the vehicle. Normal headway between trains was restored at around 9.19am, the operator said. Initial investigations point to a "signal fault aboard the train", SMRT said, adding that its engineers are attending to the situation. (CNA, 8 Aug 2014)

incident: Rail defect disrupted service between Lavender and Kallang on 26 Jul 2014
description: Due to a rail defect that has occurred between Lavender and Kallang MRT stations, all eastbound trains are traveling at slower speeds for passenger safety. Please provision for an additional 20 minutes of travel time... SMRT engineers are currently installing rail clamps to reinforce the track for passenger safety. Speed restrictions are still in place and we ask for your patience as we work hard to rectify the fault. (SMRT's media statement, 26 Jul 2014)

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Newton and Marina Bay on 23 Jul 2014
description: At 9:03am this morning at Novena station, an air pressure fault on the train caused the train's braking system to be applied, immobilising the train. A passenger service train in the rear had to be detrained at Novena and used as a rescue train to push the defective train to Newton station to detrain passengers, thus causing delays to other trains travelling towards Marina Bay station. Free bus services were made available at Toa Payoh, Novena and Newton stations. This service was later extended to Marina Bay station. Train services resumed at about 9:55am while free bus services remained available till about 10:45am. Our engineers are investigating the cause of the fault and we sincerely apologise for the inconvenience caused. (SMRT's media statement, 23 Jul 2014)

incident: Track fault disrupted service between Tampines and Pasir Ris on 18 Jul 2014
description: "Please estimate additional 20mins of travelling time from Tampines MRT station to Pasir Ris MRT station due to a track fault. Free bus service towards Pasir Ris is available at Tampines. We apologise for the inconvenience." (SMRT's FB post, 18 Jul 2014)

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Jurong East and Queenstown on 14 Jul 2014
description: A train with a brake fault at Buona Vista MRT station caused trains heading towards Joo Koon to travel at slower speeds on Monday evening (July 14). Passengers on the affected train were asked to disembark and board the next train, Mr Patrick Nathan, Vice-President of SMRT’s Corporate Information and Communications, told Channel NewsAsia. Apologising to commuters for the inconvenience, Mr Nathan said the brake fault resulted in an additional 20 minutes of travel time, with normal operations resuming at 6.40pm. SMRT does not provide bus bridging services unless the disruptions last more than an hour. (CNA, 14 Jul 2014)

incident: Sleeper replacement works disrupted service between Woodlands and Admiralty on 3 Jul 2014
description: We have imposed speed restrictions along the train tracks between Woodlands and Admiralty MRT stations. This is due to damage to trackside signalling equipment caused by a Road Rail Vehicle during resleepering work early this morning. SMRT engineers are currently on ground working on repairing the fault. Passengers are advised to provision for an additional 20 minutes of travel time. (SMRT's Facebook post)

incident: Sleeper replacement works disrupted service between Yew Tee and Sembawang on 12 Jun 2014
description: Due to re-sleepering works, an incident has occurred on the tracks going northbound between Yew Tee and Sembawang MRT stations. Engineers rectified the incident by 6am. Bus bridging and free bus services were activated and ceased around 6:30am.

incident: Power fault disrupted service between Caldecott and HarbourFront on 27 May 2014
description: [CCL]: Estimate 15 mins additional travelling time from #Caldecotttowards#HarbourFront due to power fault.

incident: Traction power fault disrupted service between Yio Chu Kang and Yishun on 2 May 2014
description: Northbound train services on the NSL between Yio Chu Kang and Yishun stations were disrupted for about 50 minutes, affecting about 1,000 passengers, when traction power could not be turned on that morning. Investigations found that SMRT’s Project Team for sleeper replacement works had failed to remove a Short Circuiting Clamp (SCC) that was installed. This was a breach to operating procedures for re-sleepering works. Since the incident, SMRT has enhanced its work processes to better account for all equipment used for sleeper replacement works. (LTA, 21 Jul 2014)

incident: Track fault disrupted service between Boon Lay and Joo Koon on 22 Apr 2014
description: [EWL]: Estimate 10 mins additional travelling time between #JooKoon and #BoonLay in both directions due to track fault.

incident: North-South Line service disrupted on 16 Apr 2014
description: SMRT did not make any public service announcements on Facebook or Twitter regarding this incident. We only know that NSL service was delayed during peak hour travel at around 8am. Cause and duration of the incident are unknown.

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Lavender and Paya Lebar on 9 Apr 2014
description: [EWL]: Estimate 10 mins additional travelling time from #Lavender to #PayaLebar towards PasirRis due to train fault. (SMRT's Twitter account)

incident: Power fault disrupted service between Dhoby Ghaut and Potong Pasir on 6 Apr 2014
description: Train services on the NEL were disrupted for close to an hour on both bounds between Farrer Park and Boon Keng stations due to a power trip. Train services resumed after the electrical fault was rectified. Investigations found that an aluminium-foil helium balloon had entered the tunnel and came in contact with an electrical insulator of the OCS near Boon Keng station, causing an electrical fault. (LTA, 21 Jul 2014)

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Dhoby Ghaut and Mountbatten on 30 Mar 2014
description: [CCL] UPDATE: Estimate 10 mins additional travelling time between #DhobyGhaut and #Mounbatten due to train fault. (SMRT's Twitter account)

incident: Train fault disrupted North-East Line service towards HarbourFront on 29 Mar 2014
description: A train fault on the North East Line caused a 40-minute service delay on Saturday. Train operator SBS Transit alerted commuters at 7.20am via its mobile app iris. It said NEL service towards HarbourFront was delayed and that commuters should expect an additional 15 minutes in travel time. In an update some 10 minutes later, SBS Transit said free buses were available at designated bus stops between HarbourFront and Dhoby Ghaut stations. At about 8am, SBS Transit reported that the North East Line was back to regular service and that it was "very sorry" for the inconvenience caused. (CNA, 29 Mar 2014)

incident: Defective third rail disrupted service between Jurong East and Outram Park on 28 Mar 2014
description: Traction power was shut off for 15 mins at 1pm along the track between Queenstown and Redhill mrt stations, as our Pway team went on track to repair an urgent 3rd rail defect picked up by our Linear Variable Differential Transducer (LVDT) sensor. Eastbound train services between Jurong and Outram Park MRT stations will be disrupted for 15 minutes. --- Our maintenance team has successfully repaired the defective 3rd rail within 10mins. Traction power has been restored to the tracks and train services have resumed. (SMRT's Facebook page)

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Yew Tee and Jurong East on 28 Mar 2014
description: SMRT tweeted, "[NSL]: Estimate 10 mins additional travelling time from #YewTee to #JurongEast towards JurongEast due to train fault."

incident: Track fault disrupted service between Outram Park and Raffles Place on 26 Mar 2014
description: SMRT tweeted, "[EWL]: Estimate 10 mins additional travelling time between Outram Park and RafflesPlace on both bounds due to track fault at Tanjong Pagar."

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Newton and Marina Bay on 24 Mar 2014
description: SMRT tweeted, "[NSL] UPDATE:Estimate 10 mins additional travelling time from #Newton to #MarinaBay towards MarinaBay due to an earlier train fault."

incident: Power fault disrupted service between Hougang and Dhoby Ghaut on 21 Mar 2014
description: Train services on the NEL were disrupted for about 40 minutes, affecting about 5,900 passengers, on both bounds between Dhoby Ghaut and Hougang stations due to a power trip. Train services resumed after the electrical fault was rectified. Investigations found that an SBST maintenance team, when carrying out non-critical maintenance work on Potong Pasir station’s electrical system, caused a short-circuit that disrupted the Overhead Catenary System (OCS) traction power supply at Boon Keng, Potong Pasir and Woodleigh stations in both bounds. SBST has since tightened its maintenance processes, and will conduct non-critical maintenance works only during non-service hours. (LTA, 21 Jul 2014)

incident: Power fault disrupted service on the Downtown Line on 7 Mar 2014
description: About 1,700 passengers were affected when the Downtown Line (DTL) service was disrupted on Friday morning for over half an hour due to a power fault. Rail operator SBS Transit said that during this time, train services in both directions at all six DTL stations were disrupted. The fault, which occurred at about 9.35am, was due to a defect in the Uninterruptible Power Supply (UPS) system at the DTL Operations Control Centre (OCC). This affected the OCC's ability to control and monitor train operations. As a result, all the trains at the stations' platforms were held back as a safety precaution. Engineers from both the DTL and Land Transport Authority were immediately activated to respond to the fault and full service resumed at about 10.10am. (CNA, 7 Mar 2014)

incident: Door fault disrupted service on the East-West Line on 3 Mar 2014
description: SMRT's media statement on Facebook: "One of the trains traveling eastbound from Pioneer to Queenstown MRT stations has encountered a door fault. All trains are hence traveling at a reduced speeds and passengers are advised to provision for an additional 15minutes of travel time." (There was no mention when the trains will be restored to normal travelling speed)

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Bedok and Outram Park on 3 Mar 2014
description: SMRT's media statement on Facebook: "Due to a faulty train, we would like to advise all passengers traveling on the EWL from Bedok to Outram Park MRT stations towards Joo Koon to provision for an additional 15minutes of travel time. SMRT engineers are working on rectifying the fault."

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Tanah Merah and Changi Airport on 2 Mar 2014
description: SMRT on Sunday said its trains were moving at slower speeds between Tanah Merah and Changi Airport stations due to a train that had developed a fault earlier. It asked commuters to take into account an additional 20 minutes of travel time between the two stations in both directions. SMRT said the defective train is now at Tanah Merah station and its engineers are investigating the exact cause of train fault. (CNA, 2 Mar 2014)

incident: Service disruption on the East-West Line towards Pasir Ris on 28 Feb 2014
description: Pictures taken at Paya Lebar station between 6:45pm and 7pm. Commuters were only informed of service disruption via PA system. No signage was put outside the fare gate to warn the public of service disruption. The electronic signboard also showed all rail line services as 'normal'. No mention of this incident on SMRT's Twitter account and Facebook page.

incident: Signalling fault disrupted service between Paya Lebar and Dhoby Ghaut on 27 Feb 2014
description: Train services on the Circle Line slowed to a crawl during the rush-hour commute yesterday, as another signalling fault — the third in four days — hit the MRT network. Operator SMRT said train services on the line were affected between 6am to 9am yesterday, after a defective signal connector was found between Mountbatten and Stadium MRT stations. This added about 20 minutes of travelling time for commuters, as trains ran at slower speeds and SMRT engineers tried to rectify the fault. SMRT spokesperson Alina Boey said additional trains were deployed to cope with the crowd build-up along the line. (TODAY, 28 Feb 2014)

incident: Track fault disrupted service between Ang Mo Kio and Marina Bay on 25 Feb 2014
description: SMRT said a fault on the signal code generator that provides the train with speed codes affected southbound services on Tuesday evening. Train services heading south from Ang Mo Kio towards Marina Bay MRT station were affected at 9.25pm. SMRT spokesperson Alina Boey told Channel NewsAsia that the fault was cleared by SMRT engineers. Passengers were alerted to provide for an additional 20 minutes of travel time. The incident was rectified after half an hour and service has since been operating normally. (CNA, 26 Feb 2014)

incident: Track fault disrupted service between Jurong East and Ang Mo Kio on 24 Feb 2014
description: A track fault along the North-South Line delayed the travel of thousands of commuters during the morning rush hour on Monday. At a little past 7am, SMRT reported a “track circuit failure” on the south bound line between Jurong East and Kranji MRT stations. It later said in its Facebook page that the service between the stations was restored at 8:32am. SMRT sent engineers to investigate and rectify the fault. While engineers were working to solve the problem, it had advised commuters to expect additional 15 minutes of traveling time and that free buses had been deployed at affected stations between Admiralty and Ang Mo Kio. (Yahoo, 24 Feb 2014)

incident: Track fault disrupted service on the Downtown Line on 7 Feb 2014
description: SBS Transit says that service is back to normal on the Downtown Line; delays of 10 min were experienced earlier due to a track fault.

incident: Track fault disrupted service between Ang Mo Kio and Marina Bay on 29 Jan 2014
description: SMRT tweeted,"[NSL]: Estimate 10 mins additional travelling time between #AngMoKio and #MarinaBay in both directions due to track fault."

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Boon Lay and Joo Koon on 29 Jan 2014
description: SMRT tweeted, "[EWL]: Estimate 10 mins additional travelling time between #BoonLay and #JooKoon in both directions due to train fault."

incident: Door obstruction disrupted service at Redhill station on 24 Jan 2014
description: SMRT has clarified there was no service disruption at Redhill MRT station on Friday night. Responding to media queries on Saturday, the public transport operator said all passengers were indeed asked to disembark from a train that arrived at the station at about 11.06pm. This came after the train doors had trouble closing as a foreign object was jamming a door. The empty train left the station at 11.14pm. The next train arrived at 11.17pm and left with passengers from the station a minute later. SMRT said the object jamming the door of the first train could have dislodged by the time the train reached the depot. During inspection, the door could close. But as a safety precaution, SMRT is getting the doors checked thoroughly before putting the train back into service. (CNA, 25 Jan 2014)

incident: Track fault disrupted service between Tampines and Tanah Merah on 22 Jan 2014
description: In the latest breakdown on Wednesday night, train services between Tanah Merah and Pasir Ris MRT stations on the East-West Line were disrupted for about an hour. SMRT attributed it to a trackside fault which had developed at 10.12pm, after a train driver bypassed a signal point without authorisation. Safety measures kicked in and as a result, train services between the four stations were disrupted. During the disruption, two trains were re-routed as a safety precaution. About 180 passengers on one train were re-routed to Simei MRT Station, while another 200 passengers on the other train had to alight at Expo MRT Station. Free bus bridging services were deployed to ferry the affected commuters between Tanah Merah and Pasir Ris stations. (TODAY, 24 Jan 2014)

incident: Signalling fault disrupted service between Woodlands and Marina Bay on 20 Jan 2014
description: Southbound train services on the NSL between Yio Chu Kang and Ang Mo Kio stations were disrupted for about 40 minutes, affecting about 19,000 passengers, after a train stalled between the two stations. Investigations found lapses by an SMRT technician and train captain. As a result of these lapses, there was no auxiliary electrical supply to the affected train. The train eventually stalled when its back-up battery power was completely drawn down, and a push-out operation had to be conducted to recover the train before service could be resumed. (LTA, 21 Jul 2014)

incident: Power fault disrupted service between Fajar and Bangkit on 19 Jan 2014
description: [SMRT's Media statement] A power fault occurred on the Bukit Panjang LRT between Fajar and Bangkit stations at 0919hrs this morning. SMRT staff were deployed immediately to the affected train to recover the fault. For passenger safety, a recovery unit was later despatched to push the affected train to Bangkit station. Passengers onboard the train were asked to alight at the station, and the defective train was sent back to the depot. Service announcements were made at the stations and within the trains to keep passengers informed. Normal service resumed at 1005hrs.

incident: Defective 3rd rail disrupted service between Bugis and Aljunied on 16 Jan 2014
description: [SMRT's Media statement] We have been alerted of a track fault between Kallang and Aljunied MRT stations via our Linear Variable Differential Transducer (LVDT), and SMRT engineers are now enroute to investigate the matter. Passengers are advised to provision for an additional 5 minutes of travelling time. UPDATE: The LVDT detected a loose insulator some distance from Kallang MRT station. We shut down power between Kallang and Aljunied MRT stations, as engineers went on track to conduct repair works. The fault has been rectified and train service has resumed as of 10.43am.

incident: Loss of traction power disrupted service between Kranji and Yew Tee on 11 Jan 2014
description: Train operator SMRT said a cable fault led to a loss in traction power between Kranji and Yew Tee MRT stations on Saturday afternoon. As a result, service between Kranji and Yew Tee MRT stations on the North-South Line was disrupted for about an hour and a half. SMRT said it detected a loss in traction power between Kranji and Yew Tee MRT stations at 12.30pm. SMRT then deployed free bus bridging services between Woodlands and Yew stations. SMRT added that train services resumed at 2.05pm and that free bus bridging services have ceased. SMRT said its engineers are still on-site conducting investigations. (CNA, 11 Jan 2014)

incident: Defective third rail disrupted service between Ang Mo Kio and Bishan on 2 Jan 2014
description: [SMRT's Media statement] Our Linear Variable Differential Transformer (LVDT), a surveillance instrument put in place to monitor track conditions and to pick up on anomalies on the conductor rails, alerted our engineers of a defective third rail between Ang Mo Kio and Bishan MRT stations earlier this morning. SMRT engineers were quickly deployed on site to assess and rectify the fault. Power was shut down at Ang Mo Kio station between 12.05pm and 12.25pm, as SMRT staff went on track to carry out repair works. Service announcements were made in trains and within the stations to inform commuters to provision for an additional five minutes of travel time between the two stations. Normal service resumed at 12.25pm.

incident: Power fault disrupted service between Bugis and Chinatown on 27 Dec 2013
description: The newly opened Stage 1 of the Downtown Line (DTL) experienced its second service disruption late on Friday night, its second such breakdown since its official launch last weekend. Friday night's disruption lasted about 40 minutes, from around 9.34pm to 10.14pm, according to train operator SBS Transit. "At about 9pm, there was a power fault affecting the Downtown Line, 50 passengers on one train were detrained at Bayfront Station. Full service resumed at 10.10pm. We apologise to all commuters for the inconvenience caused," said Tammy Tan, SBS Transit Senior Vice President of corporate communications. (Yahoo, 28 Dec 2013)

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Bugis and Chinatown on 22 Dec 2013
description: A train fault disrupted service on the opening day of the Downtown Line 1 for about 15 minutes. The fault took place at around noon near Bayfront station, and delayed train service from Bugis to Chinatown. SBS Transit senior vice-president for corporate communications Tammy Tan said: "There was a temporary disruption to service at about 12pm today due to a train fault but this was quickly resolved and full service resumed not long after." (ST, 22 Dec 2013)

incident: Power trip disrupted service between Stadium and HarbourFront on 18 Dec 2013
description: A damaged cable at one-north station caused a power failure that disrupted train services at 23 out of 30 Circle Line stations and affected about 2,900 commuters late on Wednesday night. About 300 passengers from three trains had to disembark and walk along the tracks to the nearest stations - Caldecott and Tai Seng. A Land Transport Authority (LTA) spokesman said preliminary investigations found that the contractor who had been replacing power cables at one-north station - between Buona Vista and Kent Ridge - had damaged one, resulting in a power trip. The power failure occurred at 11.21pm and affected 23 stations from HarbourFront to Stadium, said SMRT, which deployed its engineers on site to "restore traction power to the rest of the network". Power resumed only at 4am, several hours after train service ended at 12.30am. (ST, 22 Dec 2013)

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Jurong East and Outram Park on 18 Dec 2013
description: SMRT tweeted, "[EWL]: Estimate 10 mins additional travelling time from #JurongEast to #OutramPark towards #PasirRis due to train fault."

incident: Train fault disrupted service along North-East Line on 13 Dec 2013
description: According to SBS Transit's SMS alert, a train fault disrupted North-East Line service in both directions on Friday morning. It took almost an hour before full service is restored.

incident: Track fault disrupted service between Boon Lay and Joo Koon on 1 Nov 2013
description: First update at 3pm: "[Media statement] There is a track point failure at Joo Koon MRT station. SMRT engineers have been deployed to rectify the matter. Passengers traveling between Boon Lay and Joo Koon MRT stations are advised to provision for an additional 10 minutes of travel time." Separately, later at 8pm: "For passenger safety, we will be running train service between Joo Koon and Boon Lay MRT Stations on one out of the two Joo Koon station platforms. Passengers are advised to provision for an additional 10 minutes of traveling time between these two stations. SMRT engineers will be on ground after operation hours to repair the track switch to ensure optimal performance." (SMRT's Facebook post) ***Service seems to have been delayed from 3:21pm to 4:29pm and from 8:01pm till the end of revenue service (last train from Joo Koon is 12:29am).

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Dhoby Ghaut and Paya Lebar on 31 Oct 2013
description: SMRT tweeted, "[CCL]Due to a train Fault, expect longer travelling time from #DhobyGhaut towards #PayaLebar. Trains and platforms are crowded."

incident: Cable replacement works between Labrador Park and HarbourFront on 27 Oct 2013
description: To improve service reliability, we will be carrying out power cable change-out works next Sunday, 27 October 2013 from the start of operation hours till 10am between Labrador Park and HarbourFront CCL MRT stations. Trains will be operating on a single platform. We will be deploying more Service Ambassadors to guide passengers, and will be putting up directional signs and making announcements to keep everyone informed. Please make provision for an additional 10 minutes of travelling time if you are passing through Labrador Park and HarbourFront stations before 10am. (SMRT's Facebook post)

incident: Defective third rail disrupted service between Tanah Merah and Pasir Ris on 11 Oct 2013
description: [Service announcement] We have been informed of a defective third rail along the Simei-Tanah Merah stretch. For passenger safety, speed restrictions have been imposed, and SMRT engineers are currently on site to carry out investigations. An approximate 30 minute power shutdown between Tanah Merah and Pasir Ris MRT station is now underway. This is so that engineers can rectify the fault safely. Free bus services will be provided. We seek the understanding and cooperation of everyone as we conduct repair works. (SMRT's Facebook post)

incident: Track fault disrupted service between Jurong East and Joo Koon on 9 Oct 2013
description: Train services on the EWL between Boon Lay and Joo Koon stations (in both directions) were disrupted for about 70 minutes after a westbound train passed a red signal light en-route to Joo Koon station. About 10,000 passengers were affected. In the process, the train damaged a track point. Train services resumed after SMRT conducted checks on the safety and integrity of the tracks. (LTA, 21 Jul 2014)

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Jurong East and Queenstown on 6 Oct 2013
description: SMRT tweeted, "[EWL]: Estimate 20 mins additional travelling time from #JurongEast to #Queenstown towards PasirRis due to train fault."

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Yishun and Woodlands on 3 Oct 2013
description: [Media statement] A northbound train travelling between Sembawang and Admiralty MRT stations lost power at 5.07pm today. An empty train was deployed to push the affected train toward Admiralty MRT station where passengers were detrained safely. Service was resumed 30minutes later. We have already pulled the affected train out of service and SMRT engineers are currently carrying out checks and investigating the cause of the faulty train at Bishan Depot. (SMRT's Facebook post)

incident: Lightning strike disrupted service between Jurong East and Ang Mo Kio on 29 Sep 2013
description: [Media Statement] A south bound train experienced an electrical failure as a result of a lightning that struck somewhere in around Kranji station area during this morning's thunderstorm. The affected train stalled at Woodlands MRT at about 0640 hr and was later pushed back to the depot by another empty train. The incident caused an approximate delay of 35 minutes, affecting approximately 3,500 passengers. (SMRT's Facebook post) According to SMRT's tweets, extent of service disruption stretched from Jurong East to Ang Mo Kio.

incident: Signalling fault disrupted service between Farrer Road and HarbourFront on 26 Sep 2013
description: "This morning we encountered 2 signalling faults along the Circle Line, which happened one after another. Though rare, this is a known fault which SMRT has been working with LTA and its contractor to resolve. The first signalling fault occurred at 6.46am with a train between Kent Ridge and Haw Par Villa MRT stations in the direction towards HarbourFront Station. This caused the train to stop and a loss of traction power between Farrer Road to HarbourFront MRT station. The system was restored at 6.58 am, but the next train encountered a similar signaling fault at 7.03am at the same location. At 7.15am, train service towards HarbourFront station resumed to normal, ahead of the peak hour. Trains towards Dhoby Ghaut and Marina Bay stations on the Circle Line were unaffected." (SMRT's Facebook post)

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Dhoby Ghaut and Marina Bay on 24 Sep 2013
description: "We were informed at 9.04am today that a train bond signalling system caused an approximate 20-minute delay from Dhoby Ghaut to Marina Bay MRT station. Our SMRT engineers were immediately deployed on the ground to investigate and moved the defective train out. Normal service resumed at 9.28am. We will continue to monitor the situation closely." (SMRT's Facebook post)

incident: Track fault disrupted service between Raffles Place and Marina Bay on 18 Sep 2013
description: "We were informed at 309pm today that an issue with the Insulating Rail Joint (IRJ) between Raffles Place and Marina Bay MRT station caused a delay. SMRT engineers immediately proceeded to investigate and removed a small metal chip that resulted in the signalling failure, and the trains have since resumed service. The inital estimated 30 minute delay was the result of only one platform being used during the time that signal engineers went to recover the fault. We are monitoring the situation closely, and train service is now back to normal." (SMRT's Facebook post)

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Tampines and Pasir Ris on 24 Aug 2013
description: First alert tweeted at 5:26pm. "A 20 minute delay occurred on an Eastbound train en-route from Tampines MRT station towards Pasir Ris MRT station this evening at 5.37pm. A rescue train was immediately deployed, with a 12-car push out activated towards Pasir Ris MRT station. Passengers disembarked at Pasir Ris station 5.59pm, and additional passenger service staff were deployed on ground to assist passengers towards the rest of their onward journey. In the meantime, free bus services were activated to ferry passengers between Tampines and Pasir Ris stations at 6.04pm in both directions. The defective train was removed from service and will be investigated after operation hours at the depot by SMRT engineers. SMRT’s free bus service was ceased 6.52pm." -- SMRT's FB post

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Tiong Bahru and Joo Koon on 15 Aug 2013
description: According to a report in The Straits Times, train services along the East West Line were delayed for nearly 30 minutes, causing massive overcrowding at MRT stations during the morning rush hour this morning (Aug 15). Transport operator SMRT said in a Facebook post that one of its trains on the line was hit by a faulty signal code at 7.05am. As a result, the train could not operate in full automatic mode and was manually run at 18 kmh for "passenger safety". Train speeds were increased to their normal pace of up to 80kmh at about 7.27am, and crowds were cleared an hour later.

incident: Track fault disrupted service between Botanic Gardens and Caldecott on 14 Aug 2013
description: SMRT tweeted,"[CCL]: Estimate 5 mins additional travelling time from #BotanicGardens to #Caldecott towards DhobyGhaut due to track fault." Normal service resumed at 8:51am.

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Yishun and Woodlands on 14 Aug 2013
description: SMRT tweeted,"[NSL]: Estimate 20 mins additional travelling time from #Yishun to #Woodlands towards JurongEast due to train fault." Normal service resumed at 8:47am. Trains and platform still crowded.

incident: Power fault disrupted service between Phoenix and Bukit Panjang on 5 Aug 2013
description: SMRT tweeted, "[BPLRT]: Estimate 20 mins service delay from #Phoenix to #BukitPanjang due to power fault."

incident: Track fault disrupted service between Expo and Changi Airport on 3 Aug 2013
description: SMRT tweeted, "[EWL]: Estimate 10 mins additional travelling time between #Expo and #ChangiAirport in both directions due to track fault."

incident: Train fault disrupted service along the North-East Line towards Harbourfront on 30 Jul 2013
description: Train services on the North-East Line towards Harbourfront station were delayed for 25 minutes on Tuesday morning around 8.45am, said SBS transit. It was earlier reported that the delay was from 9.15am. One of the trains had to be manually driven at a reduced speed after developing a fault at Dhoby Ghaut station, said senior vice-president of corporate communications Tammy Tan. The cause of the fault is currently being investigated. The faulty train was removed from service at Harbourfront station and service was back to normal by 9.34am, not 9.40am as was earlier reported. (ST, 30 Jul 2013)

incident: Track circuit failure disrupted service between Clementi and Dover on 30 Jul 2013
description: Trains on the East-West line are travelling slower because of a track circuit failure, SMRT said. Responding to queries by The Straits Times, a spokesman said the circuit failure occurred at Clementi station at 7.19am. Signallers were deployed immediately to assess the situation. Recovery action between Clementi and Dover stations is currently ongoing and trains will be travelling at slower speeds for the safety of passengers, he added. Commuters had reported slow moving trains on the East-West line this morning and trains stopping frequently. However, SMRT's Twitter feed had no information about a disruption or delay in train services. (ST, 30 Jul 2013)

incident: Track fault disrupted service between Dhoby Ghaut and Promenade on 27 Jul 2013
description: SMRT tweeted at 6:06pm, "[CCL]: Estimate 10 mins additional travelling time from #DhobyGhaut to #Promenade towards HarbourFront due to track fault." Normal service resumed at 7:18pm.

incident: Train fault disrupted service at Woodlands station on 24 Jul 2013
description: A 12 minute delay occurred on the Northbound train at Woodlands MRT station this morning at 7.50am. There was a drop in the main reservoir pressure, which supplies air pressure to the entire train, including our doors and brakes. When the air pressure drops, our brakes will be rendered less effective and as per train design, the emergency brakes were activated for passenger safety. We de-trained the passengers at the Woodlands Northbound platform, while our train captain proceeded to rectify the fault by charging up the main reservoir. The train was thereafter removed from service and will be investigated after operation hours at the depot by SMRT engineers. Passengers were asked to board the next Northbound train as service resumed at 8.02am. (SMRT FB)

incident: Communication equipment failure disrupted service along the Circle Line on 4 Jul 2013
description: A power trip caused the communication systems on the Circle Line to fail at 5.55pm today. The SMRT team rectified and recovered the integrated supervisory control system within 15minutes and full train service was resumed by 6.10pm.

incident: Train fault disrupted service along the Bukit Panjang LRT Line on 4 Jul 2013
description: A stalled train blocked the depot exit routes on the BPLRT tracks this morning, due to an operator error. All trains were blocked from launching their scheduled routes with the exception of three LRT trains which continued providing passenger services as scheduled. Whilst the team worked quickly to rectify the stalled exit routes, SMRT immediately activated free bus bridging services from 5.10am, to ensure that passengers were able to continue their journey. The stalled train was cleared by 6.24am, and SMRT commenced launching trains progressively from the depot for service at 6.25am. Full operations resumed at 7.22am.

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Kembangan and Bedok on 25 Jun 2013
description: SMRT tweeted,"[EWL]: Estimated 25 mins additional travelling time from #Kembangan to #Bedok towards PasirRis due to train fault."

incident: Cable replacement works between Botanic Gardens and Farrer Road on 23 Jun 2013
description: On Sunday 23 June, Botanic Gardens and Farrer Road stations will operate with a single platform from 6 to 10 am. Trains going in either direction will stop at the same platform, as the other side is closed to enable cable change works. Passengers may be inconvenienced with an addition of up to 15 minutes in their travelling times between Caldecott and Holland Village.

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Woodleigh and Punggol on 19 Jun 2013
description: On 19 June 2013, train services were disrupted on both bounds between Woodleigh and Punggol stations for about 2 hours and 20 minutes. About 54,900 passengers were affected. The disruption was caused by a southbound train that had stalled after departing Buangkok station. As the fault could not be reset locally, SBST carried out a train push-out operation5 to move the stalled train to Hougang station for passengers to disembark. However, the push-out operation failed due to procedural errors made by SBST’s recovery team. Due to the protracted delay, SBST had to conduct train-to-track detrainment for the 250 passengers on board the stalled train. However, SBST failed to meet the requirement6 for such detrainment to commence within 30 minutes after the train had stalled. (LTA News Release, 1 Oct 2013)

incident: Track fault disrupted service between Ang Mo Kio and Bishan on 16 Jun 2013
description: Southbound trains on the North-South Line from Ang Mo Kio station to Bishan station (towards Marina Bay) are moving slower as a safety precaution after a track fault was found between the two stations on Sunday morning. It requests commuters to allow for four additional minutes of travelling time between the two stations on Sunday as trains are running at 18 km/h in that stretch to ensure system and passenger safety. SMRT said it was informed at 6am on Sunday that an Insulating Rail Joint (IRJ) between the Ang Mo Kio and Bishan stations was damaged. IRJs provide insulation along the running rail between two track circuits. SMRT said its engineers have restored the track circuits to prevent further damage to the IRJ, and the IRJ will be replaced after operation hours on Sunday. (CNA, 16 Jun 2013)

incident: Cable replacement works between Botanic Gardens and Farrer Road on 9 Jun 2013
description: On Sunday 9 June, Botanic Gardens and Farrer Road stations will operate with a single platform from 6 to 10 am. Trains going in either direction will stop at the same platform, as the other side is closed to enable cable change works. Passengers may be inconvenienced with an addition of up to 15 minutes in their travelling times between Caldecott and Holland Village.

incident: Power fault disrupted service between Dhoby Ghaut and Outram Park on 4 Jun 2013
description: Train services between Dhoby Ghaut and Outram Park stations on the North East Line have resumed after a disruption due to a power fault. Rail operator SBS Transit said train service was disrupted in both directions for about an hour during off-peak hours on Tuesday evening. Free bus bridging services were activated. (CNA, 4 Jun 2013)

incident: Rail crack disrupted service between Jurong East and Outram Park on 31 May 2013
description: The fourth rail crack in 2013 occurred between Tiong Bahru and Outram MRT stations on 31 May, with trains slowing to a crawl late on Friday night. -- SMRT tweeted at about 11.20pm that commuters should expect an estimated 30 minutes of additional travel time from Jurong East to Outram Park towards Pasir Ris. Engineers have been deployed on site to investigate, SMRT said on its Facebook page, and have confirmed that the rail crack is not at a welded portion of the rail. (ST, 31 May 2013).

incident: An unknown incident disrupted service along the Bukit Panjang LRT Line on 31 May 2013
description: SMRT tweeted,"[BPLRT]: Due to an incident, expect addition traveling time of 10 min, free bus service activated."

incident: Track fault disrupted service between Tanah Merah and Changi Airport on 31 May 2013
description: SMRT tweeted,"[EWL]: Estimate 20 mins additional travelling time between #TanahMerah and #ChangiAirport in both directions due to track fault."

incident: Rail crack disrupted service between Woodlands and Dhoby Ghaut on 30 May 2013
description: Trains travelling along a stretch of the North-South line will go at a slower speed until the end of service Thursday. Transport operator SMRT said trains between Yio Chu Kang and Ang Mo Kio stations will move at a slower speed of 40km per hour, instead of the usual 80km per hour. In a Facebook post, SMRT said the slowdown would continue until the end of operation hours Thursday and it would change the rail on the track between the two stations after.
