The move comes after Southbound MRT services between Woodlands and Dhoby Ghaut stations were affected on Thursday at 6.25am due to the rail crack. G-clamps have since been installed to secure the rail joint (Yahoo, 30 May 2013). SMRT said on Friday that the rail crack was caused by a corroded metal strip which caused the underside of the rail to weaken and crack.

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Pasir Ris and Jurong East on 27 May 2013
description: SMRT tweeted,"[EWL]: Estimate 10 mins additional travelling time from #JurongEast to #PasirRis due to an earlier train fault."

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Pasir Ris and Joo Koon on 24 May 2013
description: SMRT tweeted,"[EWL] UPDATE: Estimate 25 mins additional travel time from #Aljunied to #TanahMerah towards PasirRis due to an earlier train fault."

incident: Cable replacement works between Botanic Gardens and Farrer Road on 19 May 2013
description: On Sunday 19 May, Botanic Gardens and Farrer Road stations will operate with a single platform from 6 to 10 am. Trains going in either direction will stop at the same platform, as the other side is closed to enable cable change works. Passengers may be inconvenienced with an addition of up to 10 minutes in their travelling times between Caldecott and Holland Village.

incident: Rail crack disrupted service between Marina Bay and Bishan on 18 May 2013
description: The rail crack occurred near Braddell station. Statement posted on SMRT's Facebook page: "SMRT engineers have been deployed on site to carry out investigations and have installed G-clamps to secure the rail joint. Trains will be travelling at a slower speed - in compliance to safety and recovery procedures." Full replacement will take place tonight after revenue hours.

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Choa Chu Kang and Bukit Panjang on 17 May 2013
description: SMRT tweeted, "[BPLRT]: Estimate 20 mins additional travelling time between #BukitPanjang and #ChoaChuKang due to train fault at #Phoenix."

incident: Signalling fault disrupted service along the NEL on 16 May 2013
description: NEL service is delayed due to a signalling fault. Additional journey time of up to 15 minutes may be expected. NEL service resumed full operations at 10pm, about half an hour after the first SMS alert from SBST 73535.

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Pasir Ris and Joo Koon on 12 May 2013
description: SMRT tweeted,"[EWL] UPDATE: Train traveling at a slower speed. Estimate 20 mins additional travel time from #PasirRis towards #JooKoon due to train fault." - Train fault occurred earlier between Eunos and Kembangan.

incident: Cable replacement works between Marymount and Caldecott on 12 May 2013
description: On Sunday 12 May, Marymount and Caldecott stations will operate with a single platform from 6 to 10 am. Trains going in either direction will stop at the same platform, as the other side is closed to enable cable change works. Passengers may be inconvenienced with an addition of up to 10 minutes in their travelling times between Bishan and Botanic Gardens.

incident: Track fault disrupted service between Bishan and Marina Bay on 3 May 2013
description: SMRT tweeted,"[NSL]: Estimate 20 mins additional travelling time between #Bishan and #MarinaBay due to track fault."

incident: Rail crack disrupted service between Marina Bay and Ang Mo Kio on 29 Apr 2013
description: A track fault on the North South Line caused long train delays during peak hour Monday evening. Transport operator SMRT said the track fault affected northbound service between Somerset and Orchard stations. Trains were travelling slower over that stretch as a safety precaution, it added. In a tweet, it said that the track fault was "believed to be caused by a rail crack". Engineers were at the site investigating but would rectify the fault only after service hours. Several northbound commuters on the line reported travel times of double the usual period as trains kept stopping (Yahoo, 29 Apr 2013). According to SMRT's tweet, there was also a related train fault at Newton earlier, although the time of the incident was not reported.

incident: Train fault disrupted service at Newton station on 29 Apr 2013
description: Commuters were de-trained at the Newton Station at about 6pm Monday. SMRT said the faulty train was taken out of service. This resulted in longer travelling time for commuters during the peak hour. It added the issue was resolved at about 6.30pm (CNA, 29 Apr 2013).

incident: Signalling fault disrupted service between Tampines and Pasir Ris on 12 Apr 2013
description: SMRT tweeted,"[EWL]Signaling fault causing delay on East-West Line.Only one platform being used at Pasir Ris station.SMRT working on rectifying situation." Last train leaves Tampines at 12:37am.

incident: Track fault disrupted service between Tampines and Pasir Ris on 12 Apr 2013
description: SMRT tweeted,"[EWL]: Estimate 20 mins additional travelling time between #Tampines and #PasirRis in both directions due to track fault."

incident: Track fault disrupted Bukit Panjang LRT service on 9 Apr 2013
description: SMRT tweeted, "[BPLRT] UPDATE: Service A has resumed at 10.57am. It was caused by the earlier track fault." SMRT did not tweet when the delay started.

incident: Track fault disrupted service between Bishan and Marina Bay on 3 Apr 2013
description: A track fault that caused delays between Raffles Place and Marina Bay stations on the North-South Line Wednesday morning was due to the presence of a 2-cm foreign metal object. The object caused a short circuit that occurred between two track blocks. In a statement issued by SMRT at around 2.30pm that day, SMRT vice-president for corporate marketing and communications Kalai Natarajan said that the track fault was reported at 7.15am and rectified at 8.22am, after engineers were deployed to handle the situation (Yahoo, 3 Apr 2013). The delay was later extended upstream from Raffles Place to Bishan.

incident: Power trip disrupted service on the Bukit Panjang LRT on 2 Apr 2013
description: Forty passengers had to get off the LRT train they were on and walk along the emergency walkway to reach a station platform (Phoenix Station) on Tuesday morning. This happened when train service on the Bukit Panjang LRT system was disrupted for about an hour from 11.23am. SMRT's vice-president of corporate marketing and communications, Ms Kalai Natarajan, said preliminary inspection by its engineering and maintenance team showed that there was a power trip between Phoenix and Bukit Panjang stations. SMRT added that it is investigating the cause of the power trip. Free bus bridging services were activated at 11.45am to serve LRT passengers along the entire line. Sixteen buses were deployed till LRT services resumed at 12.31pm. (CNA, 2 Apr 2013)

incident: Software error disrupted service along the Circle Line on 28 Mar 2013
description: The Circle Line's automatic train timetable scheduling system experienced a software error on Thursday at about 8.10pm said SMRT's vice president of corporate marketing & communications, Ms Kalai Natarajan. The servers had to be restarted to ensure that all trains were running in accordance to their schedules. In the meantime, some trains had to be manually driven to be positioned at the correct station platforms while others had to be driven at a slower speed or temporarily held at some stations. The servers were restored at about 8.30pm and all trains on the Circle Line returned to their regular schedule about 20 minutes later. SMRT said the incident caused an average of additional 20 minutes travelling time along both bounds of the Circle Line between 8.10pm and 8.50pm on Thursday. (CNA, 29 Mar 2013)

incident: Cable replacement works between Mountbatten and Paya Lebar on 17 Mar 2013
description: SMRT will offering a bridging train service between Mountbatten and Paya Lebar stations on Sunday, 17 March, between 5.30 and 10am. This is to serve commuters who will be affected by a temporary change in normal train services to enable the replacement of power cables on the Circle Line (CCL). During this period, normal service trains will turn around when they reach either ends of the Mountbatten to Paya Lebar stretch. Commuters will have to alight at these stations, and board the shuttle train to travel through this stretch. They can then continue their journey on another normal service train at the other end of the affected stretch of stations. Commuters can expect an additional 10 to 12 minutes of travel time if their journey passes through Mountbatten, Dakota or Paya Lebar stations.

incident: Debris on tracks disrupted service between Woodlands and Marina Bay on 2 Mar 2013
description: Some passengers travelling on a SMRT train from Woodlands to the city on Saturday evening may have noticed some wooden pieces on the tracks. Channel NewsAsia viewer Edward Tan, who had spotted pieces of plywood on both sides of the track, said his journey was delayed by about 20 minutes. A SMRT spokesman told Channel NewsAsia that the plywood, which is the hoarding to mark out the walkway for workers during sleeper replacement works, had fallen from the track walkway onto the track due to heavy rain and wind on Saturday evening. The spokesman added that the trains were still safe for operations but were delayed as the SMRT staff had to remove the plywood. (CNA, 3 Mar 2013)

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Bishan and Marina Bay on 19 Feb 2013
description: SMRT tweeted,"[NSL]: Estimate 15 mins additional travelling time from #MarinaBay to #Bishan towards JurongEast due to train fault."

incident: Train fault disrupted service along the East-West Line on 15 Feb 2013
description: Eastbound train service on the East-West Line was delayed due to a faulty train at Raffles Place station on Friday evening. Rail operator SMRT said passengers were asked to alight, and the train was taken out of service. To maintain service on the unaffected stretches of the East-West Line, some trains were turned around at Queenstown and Outram Park stations (eastbound), and Bugis (westbound). Callers to the MediaCorp hotline said the delay started at about 7pm. (CNA, 15 Feb 2013)

incident: Electrical fire at Newton station disrupted service between Marina Bay and Toa Payoh on 13 Feb 2013
description: An electric cable in the northbound tunnel 5m from Newton station short-circuited and set off the fire. The fire disrupted services between Newton and Toa Payoh stations from 9.05 am. Traction power between Marina Bay and Toa Payoh stations was turned off from 10.05am as a safety precaution to allow Singapore Civil Defence Force (SCDF) officers and SMRT staff to access the tracks. As a result, services between the two stations were stopped too. The train services resumed at 11.20am. (ST, 13 Feb 2013)

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Bishan and Marina Bay on 7 Feb 2013
description: Commuters using the North-South Line had their journeys delayed by a train fault on Thursday. The train fault took place around noon at Toa Payoh, and passengers in the affected train alighted at that station before it was withdrawn from service. Commuters at the stations were told to expect 15 minutes of additional travelling time towards Marina Bay. In a tweet, SMRT noted that trains and platforms along this stretch may be crowded. The operator said train services between Bishan and Marina Bay went back to normal at 12.15pm on Thursday. (ST, 7 Feb 2013)

incident: Stalled maintenance vehicle disrupted service between Jurong East and Joo Koon on 1 February 2013
description: Train service on a stretch of the East-West Line was delayed by about 45 minutes Friday morning. An SMRT spokesman said westbound train service from Jurong East to Joo Koon started at 6am instead of 5.14am due to a stalled maintenance vehicle. Operator SMRT activated free buses for passengers travelling between the affected stations, and made announcements at all affected stations to keep commuters informed of the delay. (ST, 1 Feb 2013)

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Jurong East and Pasir Ris on 22 Jan 2013
description: A 15-minute disruption led to a delay of up to 40 minutes for rush-hour commuters at the Jurong East MRT interchange Tuesday morning. The incident occurred when SMRT pulled a faulty train out of service at around 8am, causing a disruption that rippled down to other train services following behind. SMRT said even though service intervals were between two and three minutes, they could not clear the passenger load that built up quickly on the platform from that one train withdrawal. (ST, 22 Jan 2013)

incident: Train fault disrupted service at Petir station on 11 Jan 2013
description: The Light Rapid Transit (LRT) service on the Bukit Panjang Line was delayed for about 10 minutes on Friday morning due to a train fault. This happened at about 5:20am, when a train heading towards Petir Station stalled due to the fault. There were no passengers on board. Service was delayed during the time taken to move the train and pull it out of service. Announcements were made at the affected stations and in the trains to inform commuters of the delay. (CNA, 11 Jan 2013) However SMRT did not tweet about this train delay.

incident: Power fault disrupted service between Dhoby Ghaut and Harbourfront on 10 Jan 2013
description: Train service on the North East Line (NEL) between HarbourFront NE1 and Dhoby Ghaut NE6 stations was disrupted for about six-and-a-half hours today due to a power fault. At 9.51am this morning, a power fault caused an initial delay of about 15 minutes. The fault was narrowed down to a stretch between HarbourFront and Outram Park stations and a decision was taken to shut down the line between HarbourFront and Dhoby Ghaut stations to enable engineers to enter the tunnel to conduct repair works. Train services were disrupted from 10.14 am and resumed at 4.32 pm this afternoon. (SBST, 10 Jan 2013)

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Pasir Panjang and Harbourfront on 04 Jan 2013
description: A train fault delayed service on a section of the Circle Line by 10 minutes Friday morning. In a statement, operator SMRT said a train heading towards HarbourFront experienced a fault at Pasir Panjang station at about 9.20am. The fault was cleared at about 9.30am. This resulted in additional travelling time for commuters heading in that direction, added the statement. SMRT apologised for the inconvenience caused. (ST, 4 Jan 2013)

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Bukit Batok and Marina Bay on 31 Dec 2012
description: On the North-South Line, a train fault between Kranji and Yew Tee at around 12.20pm caused a 20-minute delay for commuters travelling towards Marina Bay. SMRT had to withdraw the train. On its Twitter feed it advised commuters to expect longer travelling time from Bukit Batok towards Ang Mo Kio. (ST, 3 Jan 2012)

incident: Track fault disrupted service between Paya Lebar and Harbourfront on 31 Dec 2012
description: On the Circle Line, a track problem at Paya Lebar delayed trains travelling towards HarbourFront. On its Twitter feed, rail operator SMRT advised commuters to expect an extra five minutes of travelling time between Paya Lebar and MacPherson. The longer travelling time between these two stations led to delays farther down the line from Dhoby Ghaut. SMRT also called in staff to manually drive the trains between Dakota and MacPherson to navigate the fault. Circle Line trains began running normally again more than four hours after the fault took place around 8am. An SMRT spokesman said it took some time to rectify the fault as trains were still actively running across the affected stretch. (ST, 3 Jan 2012)

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Punggol and Little India on 20 Dec 2012
description: A one-hour disruption on the North East Line (NEL) was caused by a brake problem at one of the trains, said transport operator SBS Transit. In a statement, the company said that at 4:03pm, a train heading towards HarbourFront was immobilised by a self-activating emergency brake while approaching Serangoon Station, and remained that way despite attempts to reset it. In order that the faulty train could be taken off the main line, service was disrupted between Punggol and LIttle India stations while train service could continue between HarbourFront and Dhoby Gaut stations. At 5:03pm service from HarbourFront towards Punggol resumed and by 5:06pm service in the other direction was fully restored, the company recounted. (Yahoo, 20 Dec 2012)

incident: Body found on tracks disrupted service between Queenstown and Outram Park on 28 Oct 2012
description: A DEAD man was found lying in the MRT tunnel on Sunday night, causing train services on the East-West line to be disrupted for more than two hours. Services between Queenstown and Outram stations on both bounds were temporarily disrupted at 8.23pm for about 11 minutes. Eastbound services were thereafter suspended intermittently between 9.14pm and 10.17pm, to facilitate police and Singapore Civil Defence Force works. Westbound services were still available, but at lower frequency. Bus bridging and free bus services were available until 10.30pm at designated boarding points outside affected stations (CNA, A1, 28 Oct 2012).

incident: Power fault disrupted service on the Circle Line on 25 Oct 2012
description: A faulty power cable at Promenade station disrupted train service on the entire Circle Line on Thursday night, affecting 10,500 commuters. Bus bridging services were activated between Harbourfront and Dhoby Ghaut stations and the first bus arrived at Dhoby Ghaut at 11pm. Partial train service between Harbourfront and Paya Lebar stations resumed at 11.20pm. The sections between Stadium and Dhoby Ghaut, and Stadium and Marina Bay were closed for the rest of the evening to allow SMRT and Land Transport Authority (LTA) staff to isolate the fault. SMRT and SBST provided free bridging bus services between Harbourfront and Dhoby Ghaut stations (A1, 25 Oct 2012).

incident: Service disruption on the North-East Line on 17 Aug 2012
description: Delay in the North East Line Train Service Due to Two Faults - A Power Fault and a Subsequent Signalling Fault: Train service on the North East Line (North-East Line) has been delayed by an average of 20 minutes in both directions since the start of service this morning. At certain times, the delay was longer - at up to 50 minutes. The cause of the initial delay has been traced to a fault in the traction power system where a stainless steel U-shaped bolt holding the cantilever arm of the overhead power cables broke in the northbound tunNorth-East Line between HarbourFront and Outram Park Stations. The signalling fault which had been discovered at 2.45pm today on the Northeast Line has been fixed. Train frequencies however continue to be lower due to the traction power fault which will only be resolved at the end of revenue service today. Goodwill ambassadors are being deployed to stations that have high passenger traffic such as Harbourfront and Outram Park Stations. Free bus shuttles are being activated and will run during the evening peak period from 5.30pm along the entire line.

Passengers were then asked to alight at Kranji, after which the train was withdrawn from operations. "Our preliminary investigation showed that the white vapour was caused by coolant gas that leaked from an air-condition unit. We are investigating the cause of the leak," said SMRT.

incident: Service disruption at Ang Mo Kio station on 12 Jun 2012
description: Train service on the North-South Line was delayed for eight minutes on Tuesday evening after the cover of a train component fell off onto the tracks. But the incident, at about 6.30pm, did not pose any safety risk to commuters 'at any point in time', said rail operator SMRT on Tuesday night. It happened to a north-bound train soon after it pulled out of Ang Mo Kio station. An electrical fault in a train component led to the cover falling off, creating a loud noise, an SMRT statement said (ST, 13 Jun 2012).

incident: Service disruption between Outram Park and Raffles Place on 11 May 2012
description: SMRT tweeted, "Some trains travelling between Outram Park and Raffles Place stations in both directions are moving slower due to track fault."

incident: Service disruption between Jurong East and Joo Koon on 10 May 2012
description: Another train fault hit an east-bound train on Thursday morning, causing a 20 to 30 minute delay for peak-hour passengers travelling between Jurong East and Joo Koon stations. SMRT said the east-bound train experienced a train fault at 8.31am and was withdrawn as a safety precaution. Passengers on board were asked to alight at Jurong East MRT Station and to 'minimise the impact of the service delay to passengers', some trains were turned around at Jurong East, Clementi and Queenstown MRT stations for the eastbound service, said SMRT (ST, 10 May 2012).

incident: Service disruption between Outram Park and Bugis on 08 May 2012
description: An east-bound train experienced a train fault on Tuesday at City Hall MRT station, causing a 20-minute delay for passengers travelling between Outram Park and Bugis stations. The fault had apparently prevented the train from moving from the station platform, after passengers had alighted at about 10.30pm. The train managed to move off only after the next train arrived and pushed the affected train forward, so that it could be taken to a depot for inspection (ST, 09 May 2012).

incident: Service disruption between Jurong East and Joo Koon on 03 May 2012
description: SMRT tweeted, "Train service from Jurong towards Joo Koon moving slower due to track fault."

incident: Service disruption between Clementi and Joo Koon on 02 May 2012
description: SMRT tweeted, "Train service from Clementi towards Joo Koon moving slower due to train fault."

incident: Service disruption between Woodlands and Jurong East on 30 Apr 2012
description: SMRT tweeted, "North-bound train service from Woodlands towards Jurong is moving slower due to train fault."

incident: Service disruption between Little India and Woodleigh on 30 Apr 2012
description: North-East Line train service in the direction of Punggol, from Little India (NE7) to Woodleigh (NE11) stations is currently delayed due to a signalling fault.

incident: Service disruption on the East-West Line towards Joo Koon on 30 Apr 2012
description: The delay on the East-west line happened around 9.20am, during the morning peak period. Operator SMRT Corp said a train developed a signalling fault around Tampines station, when it was heading west towards Joo Koon. Because of the fault - which affected communication between train and track - the train had to slow down. (ST 30 Apr 2012)

incident: Service disruption between Pasir Ris and Tampines on 26 Apr 2012
description: Train services from Pasir Ris to Tampines on the East-West Line were delayed on Thursday for 15 to 20 minutes when a train broke down at around 10am. SMRT told The Straits Times that the train's pneumatic system had lost pressure, causing it to stall as its safety system kicked in. Among other functions, the pneumatic system operates doors and brakes. SMRT said it is investigating the cause of the pneumatic fault (ST, 27 Apr 2012).

incident: Service disruption at Jurong East station on 26 Apr 2012
description: At 8am on Thursday, passengers on an east-bound train were asked to disembark at Jurong East because it had a power fault. The next train arrived in two minutes. But because of the additional crowd at the station that was already jam-packed with morning commuters, many could not board until the third train came (ST, 27 Apr 2012).

incident: Service disruption on the North-South Line towards Marina Bay on 24 Apr 2012
description: SMRT tweeted, "South-bound train service moving slowly due to track fault."

incident: Service disruption on the Bukit Panjang LRT on 22 Apr 2012
description: An SMRT spokesperson said that the train service at Bukit Panjang LRT (Bukit Panjang LRT) Service A and Service C was disrupted due to a train fault between BP6 Bukit Panjang and BP13 Senja stations at about 4.45pm earlier today. SMRT added that the Bukit Panjang LRT Service B was disrupted for 9 minutes from 5.11pm to 5.20pm to facilitate Service A's detrainment to BP13 Senja. Bukit Panjang LRT Service C resumed operations at 5.40pm and Service A resumed at 7.15pm (A1, 22 Apr 2012). Train drive shaft dislodged and affected the pneumatic system powering the brakes. Train stalled when parking brake engaged for safety reasons (ST, 25 Apr 2012).

incident: Service disruption on the North-South Line towards Jurong East on 19 Apr 2012
description: SMRT tweeted, "North-bound train service toward Orchard moving slower due to track fault."

incident: Service disruption between one-north and Bishan on 18 Apr 2012
description: The interruption started at 7.40am at Botanic Gardens Circle Line Station and our engineers were immediately onsite to attend to the fault. Our Rail Incident Management Plan was activated at 8.15am. Full service on the affected train stations resumed at 10.10am. Defective insulation of an electrical fan caused short circuit in communications network which powers the signalling system. Back-up batteries kicked in, but alarm warning did not. System failed when batteries went dry after about seven hours (ST, 25 Apr 2012).

incident: Service disruption between Joo Koon and Clementi on 17 Apr 2012
description: Operator SMRT said the delays were caused by an eastbound train developing a fault at Jurong East station at around 7.25am. 'As a result, train service between Jurong East and Joo Koon in both directions was affected,' said a spokesman. 'The train travelling behind the stalled train was used to assist it and send it back to the depot.' Eastbound passengers were delayed by up to 40 minutes (ST, 18 Apr 2012). Air compressors of train pneumatic system failing because of blown fuse (ST, 25 Apr 2012).

incident: Service disruption on the North-South Line towards Jurong East via Woodlands on 16 Apr 2012
description: MRT trains travelling along the North-South line were also affected by delays in the morning peak hour and in the evening. This time the problem was due to a series of faults with the platform screen door. Delays in the evening amounted to five minutes (A1, 17 Apr 2012).

incident: Service disruption between Outram Park and Queenstown on 16 Apr 2012
description: An SMRT spokesman told AsiaOne that a track fault at Queenstown station was the cause of the congestion on the westbound track from Outram Park to Queenstown stations. In the written statement the transport provider added that in a bid to ease the congestion, some passengers on westbound trains heading towards Joo Koon were asked to disembark at Outram Park station instead. The empty trains were then turned around for use on the eastbound service. Engineers fixed the problem by 10.30am (A1, 17 Apr 2012).

incident: Service disruption on the North-South Line towards Marina Bay on 16 Apr 2012
description: Problems with platform screen doors delayed southbound trains during the morning peak (ST, 18 Apr 2012). MRT trains travelling along the North-South line were also affected by delays in the morning peak hour and in the evening. This time the problem was due to a series of faults with the platform screen door. Commuters faced longer travelling times between Jurong East and Kranji stations from 7.15am to 9.10am while the delays in the evening amounted to five minutes (A1, 17 Apr 2012). Faulty screen doors at Kranji station (ST, 25 Apr 2012).

incident: Service disruption on the Bukit Panjang LRT on 15 Apr 2012
description: On April 15, a LRT vehicle stalled between Phoenix and Teck Whye stations, resulting in a 19-minute delay. Transport Minister Lui Tuck Yew said this in a written parliamentary reply to MP for Holland-Bukit Timah GRC Liang Eng Hwa on 14 May 2012. Date of incident is known but time is not. Hence a ficticious time is provided outside non-peak hours.

incident: Service disruption between City Hall and Pasir Ris on 13 Apr 2012
description: SMRT said there was a 30-minute train service delay between Pasir Ris and Tanah Merah MRT stations Friday evening. This was due to a fault on a westbound train between Tampines and Simei station. SMRT said the train travelling behind the stalled train was used to assist it. Passengers on board the stalled train alighted at Simei station at 7.36pm, while passengers on the assisting train alighted at 7.43pm. SMRT said that eastbound passengers between City Hall and Pasir Ris MRT stations would have experienced a general service delay for a 20 to 40-minute period, as the high train frequencies operated during the rush hour can lead to a congestion when there is a train fault (CNA, 13 Apr 2012). Pressure from pneumatic system, which powers train doors and brakes, fell below operating limit because of faulty control circuit (ST, 25 Apr 2012).

incident: Service disruption on the East-West Line towards Joo Koon on 13 Apr 2012
description: SMRT tweeted, "East-bound train service delayed due to track fault."

incident: Service disruption between Paya Lebar and Pasir Ris on 08 Apr 2012
description: 45-minute disruption on the East-West MRT Line on Sunday that affected about 500 passengers. But Mr Lui said that Sunday's figures should be seen in perspective: They account for about 0.02 per cent of the 2.7 million trips made daily (ST, 09 Apr 2012). Power supply loss to train's obstacle detector, which senses obstacles on the track. System tripped for safety reasons (ST, 25 Apr 2012).

incident: Train fault disrupted Circle Line service at Marina Bay station on 3 Apr 2012

Our station staff was immediately activated to stand-by to drive the train manually into the platform. However, the Operations Control Centre was able to rectify the fault and move the train fully into the platform 5 minutes later. The train was subsequently withdrawn to the depot for checks."

incident: Service disruption on the North-South Line towards Marina Bay on 03 Apr 2012

incident: Service disruption between Serangoon and Caldecott on 31 Mar 2012
description: A SMRT spokesperson said the delay of train service between Caldecott and Seragoon MRT stations - in the direction of Dhoby Ghaut - was due to additional time needed to remove an engineering vehicle that had broken down at Bishan station during maintenance hours. To mantain service, a shuttle train service was operated between Seragoon and Caldecott stations at 5.54am, and passengers travelling beyond this stretch in either direction needed to make a transfer at Serangoon and Caldecott to continue their journey. This lasted till around 6.22am, before normal train services resumed. Around 100 passengers at these three stations experienced delays of around 10 and 28 minutes. (Today, 31 Mar 2012)

incident: Service disruption between Dhoby Ghaut and Harbourfront on 15 Mar 2012
description: LTA's investigations found that the service disruption was caused by the snapping of a pair of stainless steel wires, which formed part of the counterweight systems holding in place overhead power lines that provide electricity to the trains. The primary cause for the broken wires was corrosion. Laboratory tests revealed that the majority of wire strands of the snapped wires had broken due to Stress Corrosion Cracking. This is a gradual process of propagation of cracks in the wire strands due to contact with tunNorth-East Line seepage water. LTA's findings further revealed that SBST had not carried out immediate diversion/rectification works on tunNorth-East Line leaks at the incident site, and was not sufficiently diligent in detecting and replacing the corroded wires.

incident: Service disruption between Marina Bay and Promenade on 19 Jan 2012
description: On 19 January at around 12.08pm, train service between Circle Line (Circle Line) Marina Bay and Promenade stations was disrupted due to a fault on a signaling equipment along the track. Train service on the affected stretch resumed at 12.40pm.

incident: Service disruption between Marina Bay and Bishan on 13 Jan 2012
description: SMRT tweeted, "North-bound service from Marina Bay to Bishan slightly delayed due to train fault." but did not report recovery time.

description: SMRT tweeted train fault after recovery is completed. No alert was given when the disruption started.

description: Trains plying between Caldecott and Botanic Garden Stations in both directions on the Circle Line had to move slower for some three hours, until service returned to normal at about 4pm. incident: Service disruption between Boon Lay and Joo Koon on 08 Jan 2012
description: SMRT said that a suspected power fault between Joo Koon and Boon Lay stations resulted in an additional one to two minutes' waiting time on the eastbound service at 12.30pm. East-West line service resumes after power fault. Crowds of commuters were seen on the platforms of affected stations as waiting time became slightly extended from between four and five minutes to six minutes until about 1pm.

description: SMRT tweeted, "East-bound service to Pasir Ris is slightly delayed". Did not report recovery time.

incident: Service disruption between Yishun and Jurong East on 22 Dec 2011
description: SMRT tweeted track fault but did not report recovery time.

incident: Service disruption between Outram Park and Harbourfront on 20 Dec 2011
description: SBS Transit said that a signalling fault that took place at about 7:45am triggered a 20-minute delay between Outram Park and HarbourFront MRT stations, in the direction of HarbourFront.

incident: Service disruption at Orchard station on 19 Dec 2011
description: SMRT said normal service resumed at 6.55pm. But passengers on southbound service near Orchard station had experienced a slight delay at around 7pm as the train was withdrawn to a depot via the southbound track. Commuters said they were asked to alight from the train at Orchard MRT station. There were also tweets about the East-West Line being affected - with passengers reporting delays near Bedok and Tanah Merah stations. SMRT, however, refuted claims of prolonged delays.

incident: Urgent Maintenance on NSEast-West Line on Sunday 18 Dec 2011
description: Full inspection of tracks and trains; East-West Line resumed full service at 11 AM instead of 10 AM.

incident: Urgent Maintenance on NSEast-West Line on Sunday 18 Dec 2011
description: Full inspection of tracks and trains; North-South Line resumed full service at 12:08 PM instead of 10 AM.

incident: Service disruption between Ang Mo Kio and City Hall on 17 Dec 2011
description: About 94,000 commuters were hit after five trains stalled between Ang Mo Kio and City Hall stations on that morning. As with the earlier incident, the cause was traced to a misalignment between the trains and the power rail.

incident: Service disruption between Marina Bay and Bishan on 15 Dec 2011
description: Caused by damaged third rail between Dhoby Ghaut and City Hall MRT stations, which also damaged the collector shoes of four trains.

incident: Service disruption between Marymount and one-north on 14 Dec 2011
description: Following the train service disruption on the Circle Line between Marymount and onenorth MRT stations yesterday morning between 6.00am and 6.40am, our staff worked around the clock to correct the fault. However, the communication network problem is still unresolved and our engineers continue to work with the system supplier Alstom and the Land Transport Authority to stabilise the system at the soonest possible time.

incident: Service disruption between Ang Mo Kio and Bishan on 17 Oct 2011
description: A southbound train between the Ang Mo Kio and Bishan MRT stations experienced a fault around 10:30am, affecting some 5,600 passengers. Services were up and running 40 minutes later. But, while the faulty train was being hauled back to the depot, it delayed a northbound train travelling towards Ang Mo Kio for about an hour. Some 1,800 passengers were affected, but train services were restored after noon.

incident: Service disruption between Labrador Park and Pasir Panjang on 17 Oct 2011
description: Earlier in the day, a Circle Line train experienced a fault around 8:40am. It was heading from Labrador Park to Pasir Panjang station and had to be taken out of service.

incident: Train fault disrupted service between Kallang and Joo Koon on 14 Oct 2011
description: On 14 Oct at around 5.50pm, a westbound train at Kallang MRT Station had a train fault and had to taken out of service. As a result, westbound train service between Kallang and Bugis was disrupted for 20 mins. To maintain westbound service on unaffected stretches, trains were turned around at Eunos and Bugis. Train services resumed at around 6.10pm, but passengers on the westbound services experienced longer waiting time between Kallang to Joo Koon due to the heavy evening peak hour passenger flow. For safety reasons, between 6.00 to 6.20pm, passengers at Tanjong Pagar MRT station were requested to wait before entering through the faregates, to prevent overcrowding at platform. The train fault could not have come at a worse time with SMRT having their annual Dinner and Dance on the same day.

incident: Service disruption between Buangkok and Punggol on 05 Oct 2011
description: Between Buangkok and Punggol (NEL), 40-minute delay affecting 26,600 commuters from 9.18pm (TNP, 21 Apr 2012)

incident: Service disruption between Marymount and Dhoby Ghaut on 20 Sep 2011
description: The Circle Line between Dhoby Ghaut and Marymount MRT stations was unable to commence passenger service due to a power fault. Our preliminary investigations show that the power fault was due to a faulty cable located beneath the platform level at Dakota station.

incident: Service disruption on the Bukit Panjang LRT on 07 Jun 2011
description: On 7 June at around 9.40am, train service at the Bukit Panjang LRT (Bukit Panjang LRT) system was disrupted due to a signaling fault between BP5 Phoenix and BP6 Bukit Panjang stations.

incident: Service disruption on the Bukit Panjang LRT on 17 May 2011
description: Electrical fault between Bukit Panjang LRT stations 3 and 1 (BP3 Keat Hong, BP2 South View and BP1 Choa Chu Kang).

incident: Service disruption between Outram Park and Queenstown on 07 Apr 2011
description: A DISRUPTION to train services on Thursday morning inconvenienced 17,500 commuters. An eastbound train stalled at 8.49am due to a fault in the train, according to an SMRT spokesman. Westbound and eastbound trains were turned around at Queenstown MRT Station and Outram Park MRT Station respectively to maintain services. Eastbound train service resumed at 9.50am.

incident: Service disruption between Outram Park and Harbourfront on 01 Mar 2011
description: A technical fault with a signalling system track module was responsible for the disruption of services between the Outram Park and HarbourFront stations, said Ms Tammy Tan, senior vice-president of corporate communications at SBS Transit, which operates the line.

incident: Service disruption on the Bukit Panjang LRT on 30 Nov 2010
description: On 30 November at around 3.00pm, train service at the Bukit Panjang LRT system was disrupted due to a power fault. Four trains with a total of 88 passengers were stalled between stations.

incident: LTA's turnout installation works on the Jurong East Modification Project (JEMP)
description: No train service between Bukit Batok and Jurong East stations

incident: LTA's turnout installation works on the Jurong East Modification Project (JEMP)
description: No train service between Clementi and Jurong East stations

incident: Incident at Bedok station on 07 May 2010
description: On 7 May at about 1.45pm, eastbound train service between Eunos and Tanah Merah MRT stations was disrupted when a man was hit by a train at Bedok MRT Station.

incident: Service disruption on the Bukit Panjang LRT on 23 Apr 2010
description: Train service at the Bukit Panjang LRT was disrupted at about 5.30pm on Friday due to a power trip caused by lightning. As a result, two trains with a total of 100 passengers were stalled between Phoenix and Bukit Panjang LRT stations. The engineers were able to restore power at 5.48pm on one of the trains, which proceeded to Phoenix Station for about 35 passengers to disembark. However, power could not be restored on the second train. Due to lightning risk and the heavy rain, a rescue train was sent to push out the train. Service was resumed at 6.30pm (CNA, 24 Apr 2010).

incident: Service disruption between Serangoon and Hougang on 21 Apr 2010
description: In a statement, SBS Transit, which runs the North-East Line said: "At 8.25am this morning, service on the North-East Line was affected due to technical faults with the signalling and communication systems. "Service was temporarily disrupted for about 26 minutes between Serangoon and Hougang stations. As a result, train service at the other stations slowed down considerably."

incident: Incident at Clementi station on 24 Mar 2009
description: On 24 March at 6.15am, westbound train service between Queenstown and Jurong East MRT stations was affected when a woman was hit by a train at Clementi MRT Station.

incident: Incident at Choa Chu Kang station on 07 Apr 2008
description: On 7 April 2008, northbound train services from Yew Tee to Bukit Gombak MRT stations were disrupted at 8.00am when a man was hit by a train at Choa Chu Kang MRT Station

incident: Service disruption between Pasir Ris and Tanah Merah on 21 Jan 2008
description: On 21 January 2008, there were no westbound and eastbound train services between Pasir Ris and Tanah Merah MRT stations from the start of train service at 5.28am till 12.45pm. The disruption was caused by the breakdown of a maintenance works train which was carrying out works between Tampines and Simei (westbound) MRT stations.

incident: Incident at Kranji/Marsiling station on 25 Dec 2007
description: On 25 December 2007, southbound train service between Yew Tee and Woodlands MRT stations was disrupted at 9.43 am when someone jumped onto the southbound track at Kranji MRT Station. Police and SCDF were on site to investigate the incident but no one was found. However, at 11.12 am, northbound train service between Woodlands and Kranji MRT stations was disrupted when a man was hit by a train at Marsiling MRT Station.

incident: Service disruption between Marina Bay and Newton on 01 Nov 2007
description: On 1 November 2007, southbound train services from Newton to Marina Bay MRT stations, and northbound train services from Marina Bay to Raffles Place MRT stations were disrupted when a cable along the track short-circuit near the tail wall of the Dhoby Ghaut MRT Station at about 6.13pm.

incident: Incident at Clementi station on 20 Jul 2007
description: On 20 July 2007, eastbound train service between Jurong East and Queenstown stations was disrupted at 1.05 pm when a woman was hit by a train at Clementi Station.

incident: Service disruption between Dhoby Ghaut and Harbourfront on 04 May 2007
description: Dislodged power connector caused a power trip.

incident: Incident at Paya Lebar station on 04 Apr 2007
description: On 4 April 2007, eastbound train service from Aljunied to Eunos stations was disrupted at 10.21am when a man was hit by a train at Paya Lebar Station.

incident: Incident at Woodlands station on 02 Mar 2007
description: On 2 March 2007, northbound train service from Admiralty to Kranji stations was disrupted at 3.20pm when a woman was hit by a train at Woodlands Station.

incident: Incident at Eunos station on 23 Jan 2007
description: On 23 January 2007, eastbound train service from Aljunied to Tanah Merah stations was disrupted at 3.01pm when a man was hit by a train at Eunos Station.

incident: Incident at Yishun station on 05 Dec 2006
description: On 5 December 2006, southbound train service from Sembawang to Yishun stations was disrupted at 6.51am when a man was hit by a train at Yishun Station.

incident: Incident at Admiralty station on 02 Dec 2006
description: On 2 December 2006, southbound train service from Woodlands to Sembawang stations was disrupted at 2.08 pm when a man was hit by a train at Admiralty Station.

incident: Incident at Clementi station on 30 Oct 2006
description: On 30 October 2006, westbound train service between Jurong East and Queenstown stations was disrupted at 7.51 pm when a man was hit by a train at Clementi Station.

incident: Incident at Chinese Garden station on 18 Oct 2006
description: On 18 October 2006, westbound and eastbound train services between Jurong East and Boon Lay stations were disrupted at 10.12 pm when a man was hit by a train at Chinese Garden station.

incident: Service disruption between Dhoby Ghaut and Harbourfront on 24 Jul 2006
description: Full recovery of the line took place at 2.10am this morning after more than 70 engineers and station staff worked round the clock to get the system going. Trial runs were conducted before the system was given the final go-ahead to resume service operations at 5.42am – the normal scheduled start of southbound services. It is estimated that 60,000 commuters were affected by the partial stoppage of North-East Line services yesterday.

incident: Service disruption on Bukit Panjang LRT on 07 Apr 2005
description: All 11 LRT trains in the system were stalled by the Singapore Power power services outage.

incident: Service disruption between Serangoon and Punggol on 07 Feb 2004
description: no description

incident: Service disruption between Pasir Ris and Tampines on 08 Aug 2003
description: Two successive train delays caused by the loss of traction current

incident: Service disruption between Yio Chu Kang and Sembawang on 16 Apr 2003
description: Power supply to trackside equipment between Khatib and Sembawang stations was disrupted by lightning strike, affecting eight point machines along the 4.54 km track. Point machines allows trains to switch from one track to another.

incident: Service disruption between Yio Chu Kang and Yishun on 03 Mar 2003
description: A car veered off Lentor Avenue and crashed onto the northbound track between Yio Chu Kang and Khatib stations. The driver managed to get out of the car before an oncoming train hit it.

incident: Incident at Ang Mo Kio station on 11 Jan 2003
description: A woman was hit by a train at Ang Mo Kio station. About 600 passengers in the affected train were detrained at 6:40 pm.

incident: Service disruption on the Bukit Panjang LRT on 21 Oct 2002
description: The Bukit Panjang LRT train service was disrupted at 6:38am today after a power trip occurred between Bukit Panjang and Senja stations. Preliminary investigation showed that one of the eight guide-wheels of the train had dislodged into the viaduct trough and 1 km of the signal/ground rail had been damaged.

incident: Service disruption between Yew Tee and Kranji on 04 Oct 2002
description: Thick smoke was observed arising from a factory near the viaduct. As a safety precaution, train service along the affected stretch was halted temporarily.

incident: Service disruption on the Bukit Panjang LRT on 07 May 2002
description: A computer glitch caused the Bukit Panjang LRT service to be suspended for almost five hours on Tuesday night. Singapore LRT (SLRT) said a fault on the main LRT lines caused the computers that control the guideway switches and train-tracking system to shut down (Today, 09 May 2002).

incident: Train collision on the Bukit Panjang LRT on 29 Aug 2001
description: At least 18,500 people were affected when the Bukit Panjang LRT was shut down at 5:38pm on Wednesday evening due to a collision between a train and a switch beam on the tracks. Normal service was resumed nearly 17 hours later - the longest service interruption since it was launched in 1999 (Today, 31 Aug 2001).

incident: Train collision on the Bukit Panjang LRT on 19 Nov 2000
description: LRT train collision at Phoenix station. Three people were injured while 20 others had to be evacuated from the two trains. Fortunately the train was approaching at just 16 km/h and the collision wasn't very violent. The couplers of the two trains collided, forcing one of them to hit the power rail, causing a deflection in the rail (Today, 20 Nov 2000).

incident: Train collision at Clementi station on 5 Aug 1993
description: At 7:50 am on 5 August 1993, an East-bound train from Jurong stopped at the Clementi Station for two minutes longer than scheduled due to a technical fault. It was then hit by another train. Operations at the three affected stations, namely, Clementi, Buona Vista and Commonwealth resumed within a day after intensive checks were carried out by Mass Rapid Transit Corporation (MRTC) engineers to ensure that the tracks, signals, power and other installations were functioning properly. The train, comprising six carriages, had a full capacity of 1,800 passengers. The peak-hour collision injured 156 commuters. Several passengers were flung against panels and steel railings of the train or piled on top of one another, suffering multiple injuries.
